MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Join Us For Our 24th Annual Cyclocross Camp, August 2-3 and 4-5, 2025

The Cycle-Smart Cyclocross Camp is the original, most popular, and most emulated 'cross camp in North America. The camp's unique attraction lies in its beautiful setting, fun atmosphere, mix of ability levels and personalities, and the opportunity to learn and practice skills with America's best and most experienced 'cross coaches and racers.

Camp is open to riders of all ability levels, and Cycle-Smart coaches provide in-depth instruction in technique and training. While all comers are welcome, everyone must have a USA Cycling license. Unlicensed riders can purchase a license at the camp or in advance for an additional charge.

For riders under the age of 15, we have a specific coaching group and discounted entry cost of $300, limited to 15 spots.

The camp’s alumni speak for themselves. Jeremy Powers, Ellen Noble, Stephen Hyde, Curtis White, Lyne Bessette, Emma White, Mike van den Ham, and so many others got their start as participants at our camp. Many have returned as coaches. There is no other camp like it.

In addition to our traditional weekend skills-focused camp, we are offering a 2-day Monday-Tuesday training-focused camp option, limited to 20 riders. This is an opportunity to do two big days of cyclocross-specific training with Cycle-Smart coaches and ‘cross pros like Adam Myerson, Mike van den Ham, Alec Donahue, and Stephen Hyde. Participants must have completed the weekend skills camp, and be a minimum USAC Cyclocross Cat. 4 and racing age 13 to register.

Camp Info

2025 Coaches: Adam Myerson, Alec Donahue, Stephen Hyde, Jordan Villella, Austin Killips, Ellen Noble, and Jeremy Powers.

Dates: August 2-3 and 4-5, 2025

Weekend Skill Camp Price: $600

Weekday Training Camp Price: $400

Level 4 'Cross Camp Training Program: $250. This is a training program designed to complement the skills and knowledge you will gain when attending the 'cross camp. The training program will take you from the weekend of the 'cross camp through to the end of the cyclocross season.

PLEASE NOTE: The Level 4 'Cross Camp Training Program is ONLY available to people purchasing one of the camp attendance registration options.

More Information About The Level 4 Training Program

Refunds: Individual refunds will be provided up until the close of registration.

Lodging

Lodging is not included in the camp. There are many nearby lodging options in Northampton, Amherst, Springfield, Westfield, and Greenfield. Allowing attendees to choose their own lodging gives people the freedom to find accommodations to match their budget and preferences.

Ever heard of cyclocross but don't know much about it?

Never heard of cyclocross but like to have fun on your bike?

Come find out what the fuss is about and how you, yes you, can race cyclocross this season!

 

This event is for those who identify as women or nonbinary. 

This is a trans friendly space. 
 

The clinic will run from 9-11 at Allmendinger Park. Parking is available on the surrounding streets. The clinic will include an overview of cyclocross and how the race works, some off bike instruction, and drills. You do not need to have any previous experience with cyclocross, mountain biking, or any kind of racing! This clinic is designed to create a safe and welcoming space for women and non-binary folx to learn about cyclocross and practice some of the skills involved! 

Please be sure to bring the following:

*A bike (a road bike with smooth skinny tires is not recommended)

*Water

*Helmet

*Closed toe shoes

Cyclocross season is just around the corner, and now is the time to start preparing!

There will be two programs held simultaneously: one for beginner racers and one for experienced racers.

We’ll be clinic-ing at Driskell Park in Hyattsville, MD - home of the annual (and very fun) Hyattsville CX race.

Beginners Group

This is for the true CX beginner. Sign up here if one (or more) of these describe you:

  • You've been curious about giving cyclocross a try but didn't know where to start.
  • You've raced a handful of times but haven't found your way through the pack.

We'll cover everything you need to get started: equipment, race day prep, fundamental skills, training strategies, and more.

There is a nominal registration fee for this field. We've done our best to keep the price as low as possible for beginners - come give cyclocross a try!

If you don't have a USA Cycling racing license, you will need a one-day license ($15) for this event. BEFORE YOU REGISTER, reach out to us about getting a one-day license - we may be able to help defray the cost of this license for some beginners!

Experienced Group

Already have experience on the course, but looking for a refresher on skills or want feedback on what you're already doing? We'll have experienced, pro-racer coaches working with you in small groups to get ready for the season. Sign up for this if you feel like you've got the basics down, have a few seasons under your belt, or don't otherwise fit into the Beginner category.

Not sure what to register for?

Reach out to us using the “Contact Us” link below and we'll figure it out with you!

FAQ

  1. What if I've never tried cyclocross before?

    This is the perfect opportunity to give it a try! The Beginners group will cover everything you need to give racing a try, plus the fundamental skills you will use in all of your races. We'll also provide ongoing resources throughout the season to help you progress.
     
  2. I'm a junior and I'd love to attend, but it's not letting me register! What gives?

    Unfortunately, we don't have the resources to host juniors at this clinic. All participants must be 18 years old on the date of the event (NOT racing age). Fortunately, there are some great resources in the DC-Baltimore area for junior racers. Check out Rock Creek Velo (RCV) and Baltimore Youth Cycling (BYC) for programs they are running. 
     
  3. What bike should I bring? What if I don't have a cyclocross bike?

    While a cyclocross bike is great, don't worry if you don't have one. Gravel bikes are also great for cyclocross, as are mountain bikes. If you have a hybrid style bike, that can also be great. Road bikes don't generally have the greatest clearance for the bigger tires used in cyclocross. A lot of people race with clipless pedals (which are great), but flat pedal are also great. But if you're not sure what you have will work, reach out to us and we'll figure something great out! Bikes are great!
     
  4. Wait, why is the beginner clinic cheaper?

    One of the main goals of this clinic is to get new people into the sport, so we are subsidizing the beginner fee. (If you think you're being clever by registering for the beginner level to save a few bucks, don't worry - we'll be checking Cross Results.) ;)
     
  5. I'm not sure what to register for - help!

    Contact us using the link below and we'll figure it out. But in general, the beginner group is really just for those who are starting their journey in cyclocross. If you've already upgraded out of novice, or have several years of racing experience (even if you're Cat 5/Novice), that's probably not you, so go ahead and register for the experienced group. The main difference will be the subsidized registration fee - if you end up being a better fit for the beginner group, we'll shuffle things around day-of to make sure you get the most out of the experience!
     
  6. What do I get for my registration fee?

    The registration fee covers the insurance and permit fees for USAC. We'll also be providing lunch and some snacks. And we'll have a professional mechanic on hand to deal with any bike troubles. And we want to help cover our coaches’ travel and incidental expenses. Anything left over will go toward further encouraging the growth of the local cyclocross scene. As many have learned, there's no money to be made in local cyclocross - it's all for the love of the sport. (And as a wise woman has said, “If I end up paying someone $75 to force me to practice for 8 hours, that's money well spent.”)
     
  7. Do I need a USAC license?

    Yes! All participants will need a current USA Cycling (USAC) license! If you've had one previously and it's expired, now is a great time to renew. And if you've never had one, you can get a novice one-day license during registration. But before you do that, reach out to us - we may be able to help with the one-day license cost!
     
  8. What kinds of things will we cover?

    We'll have a mix of short lessons, followed by on-the-bike practice. Skills covered will include race starts, dismounts and remounts, cornering techniques, barriers, bike shouldering, and hand-ups. More advanced racers may cover additional skills, like bunny hopping, as time allows.
     
  9. Who's putting this thing on?

    The clinic is being put on by folks from Crosshairs Cycling Club and Bluemont Connection Cyclocross, as well as a choice selection of Mid-Atlantic cyclocross heavy hitters for coaching expertise and a local and exceptional bicycle mechanic to keep bikes running smoothly.

We are happy to announce that the Kings CX Time Trial Series at Kingswood Park will be coming back! 

For over 15 years this series has been a great way for first time and experienced CX riders to come out, train hard and hang with other members of our CX tribe. The format is simple: a local host team sets up an approximately 3 mile "course" using cones to simulate some of the elements of CX. Then we line folks up in rows of 3 and send you off at 15 sec intervals to complete 1, 2, or 3 laps of your choosing. 

Timing:

The "timing Gods" willing, we will hopefully have some sort of time recorded that we can report back to this page later that evening/next day. NOTE:  If you need absolutely accurate training times each week we strongly recommend having your Garmin/Wahoo and ready to go. #glitcheshappen 

More Details:

Dates: Aug 13th, 20th, 27th, Sept 3rd

Registration:  Will be via BikeReg, opening Aug 1 (likely sooner), $15/night,  Look for links to be posted here.

Registration closes at NOON of race day. There is NO on-site registration.

No USAC license required but helmets and a signed waiver (on-line) are required to participate. No exceptions!!

Parents can follow their small juniors but must have a helmet and signed waiver also.

Time:  

5:45 - Number pick up / Pre Ride, 

6:30- Pre TT announcements-Line Up, 

6:45 - First Riders off

 

Distance: 1, 2, or 3 laps of a 2.75-3 mile cone marked loop

Prizes/Podiums: None. Zero. Nada. This is just a training ride....So this is for "personal glory" and all of the fun of playing bikes with your friends in a park until the street lights come on.. 

Special Thank You to: 

Spoken Bicycles/Team Optimist, Bishop Bicycles, Queen City Wheels, and Brilliant Advice Racing + Team Hungry for being our Host Teams this year! You all are the best!

Saturday, August 16th and Sunday, August 17th, 2025 at YMCA Camp Sloper

Now in its eighth edition, the CCAP's Summer Youth Cyclocross Training Camp is dedicated to preparing junior cyclists for the upcoming cyclocross season by combining a focus on beginner-to-intermediate skills and technique development with a fun, practice, and race environment. Youth riders will hone skills to better handle all of New England’s cyclocross challenges, including run-ups, roots, barriers, off-camber sections... and much more!

The camp is for boys and girls, ages 9–18, of all experience levels. Camp staff will ensure every camper is prepared for their CX-season goals. No rider will be left unchallenged, overwhelmed, or under-encouraged.

Register before July 26th and receive a free one-of-a-kind limited-edition Camp t-shirt.   
The first 10 people who register get 10% off their registration fees.

 

CAMP INCLUDES:

  • Two days of training with a focus on skills development, technique, and training races
  • Fun community-style learning sessions on off-the-bike topics such as nutrition, bike care, and recovery tips.
  • Access to a private cyclocross course open ONLY for the camp weekend.
  • Lunch is provided. Ride food and snacks are served throughout each day.

CAMP SCHEDULE:   
Camp hours will be roughly from 8 AM to 4 PM each day, packed full of skills, drills, and a mock racing experience. Campers will receive the final schedule in their emails the week before camp. Parents, please make sure you put YOUR email into your child's BikeReg account to make sure you receive all updates and important notices. The CTCX camp is a drop-off day camp. After check-in each day, parents will be asked to leave, and are encouraged to explore the downtown Southington area nearby during camp hours. 

CAMP FEES:   
$225 for the first 10 campers that register, $249 after that. 

All campers are required to hold a 2025 USA Cycling junior race license.

CLOSEST BIKE SHOP:

  • Bobby Sprocket: 10 minutes from Camp

LOCAL ACCOMMODATIONS:

  • Courtyard Southington: 12 minutes from Camp
  • Homewood Suites by Hilton: 12 Minutes from Camp
  • Holiday Inn Express: 12 minutes from Camp

LOCAL DINING OPTIONS:

  • Kinsman Brewing: 12 minutes from Camp
  • Ideal Tavern: 8 minutes from Camp
  • 75 Center: 8 minutes from Camp
  • Tacos Mi Nacho: 12 minutes from Camp
  • Viron Rondo Osteria: 11 minutes from Camp
  • Wood-n-Tap: 10 minutes from Camp

CANCELLATION POLICY:   
Camp fees are non-refundable.
For more info on the CTCX Camp, contact CCAP at info@ctcyclingadvancement.com

SPONSORS - Ann Arbor Running Company | Q+M | Michigan Bicycle Law | York Food & Drink | Sic Transit Cycles | Wheels in Motion | Motor City Bicycle | Jolly Pumpkin + Kitchen | Pactimo | BLØM | Bank of Ann Arbor | Brent McDermott Realtor

CXpreX presented by the Ann Arbor Velo Club is a cyclocross clinic and “race” to introduce cyclists to the art of cyclocross. If you have a gravel, mountain or any type of bike that can handle a little off road riding, then this clinic is for you. After the clinic we can guarantee you'll be more confident on your bike wherever you ride or your money back!

2025 DATE & LOCATION

  • Sunday 8/17 - Hunt Park - 1035 Daniel St, Ann Arbor, MI 48103

FUNdamentals - the FUNdamentals group will be lead by women from the Ann Arbor Velo Club and is designed to be a welcoming, non judgmental place to try cyclocross and see how much FUN you can have playing on bikes in cyclocross!

TIME - 5:00-6:30pm

  • 5:00-6:00pm Clinic
  • 6:00-6:30pm Race

ALL ABILITIES & AGES WELCOME!!!

CLINIC TOPICS

  • Dismounts, Remounts, Barriers, Cornering, Run Up and Starts

Participants will receive an email with some homework to get done before each clinic.

Please come join us for a few hours of fun on bikes!

 

Welcome to our Summer Cyclocross Clinics! We will be offering two clinics this summer for new or experienced riders. Learn the basic skills, prepare for racing, or refresh skills for the fall. We will give instructions on safe riding, equipment set-up and the fundamentals of cyclocross such as dismounts and remounts, cornering, and bike transitions. Finish the clinic with time on course to apply on what you learned.  

 

Cyclocross, gravel and mountain bikes (w/out bar ends) are all welcomed. Must wear a helmet.

 

Minimum USAC “Ride Safe Membership” ($20) is required.

 

Dates:

Monday July 21, 2025

Monday August 18, 2025

 

For more information see www.sharkriverdevo.com/events.

 

We believe in creating an inclusive environment for all. Regardless of your race, color, religion, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, or any other characteristic protected by law, you belong here. This ethos is integral in building a strong and lasting community that provides opportunities for all cyclists.

Full Moon Vista is pleased to bring you the second annual Epic Cross event for 2025! For 2025 the course has been modified slightly and will be an unconventional 5.4 mile looped course combining cyclocross, gravel, mountain and road centered around Dryer Road Park in Victor NY. As part of the 2025 Roc Bike Fest - you won't want to miss out on the fun!

Licensing and Equipment Requirements:

  • USA Cycling licenses are NOT required
  • E-bikes are NOT allowed
  • A cyclocross, gravel or mountain bike will work great! 

Categories and Fields:

  • Each field has a note regarding our recommendation about who is suited to be in that race.
  • Please note - participation in this event will NOT award any ranking points or upgrade opportunities.
  • If you have questions about which field you are best suited for, please email shana@fullmoonvista.com

Registration:

  • Please pre-register!
  • But if you can't, day-of registration opens at 6:30 a.m. and closes at 7:30 a.m.!
  • Adult day-of registration is $60 - juniors go up to $30 on the day.

Still have questions? Email shana@fullmoonvista.com

MatchingEvents.EventName: Team Winston Salem - Velocious Sport Cyclocross Camp
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
9am-3pm both days

Coaches for this year's camp:

  • Jonathan Page - World Champ's Silver Medal, Multiple Time National Champ
  • Allison Lancaster (maybe) - Former Pro CX Star
  • Jules van Kempen - Pro CX Star
  • Alicia Hamblen - Three time National Champ
  • Spencer Johnston - the best mechanic in the world
  • Jonny Hamblen - some old guy

Day of registration is available at the venue.

Parking in the field at The Farm, 1411 Whitaker Ridge Rd, look for signs. A typical Farm course preview on yOUtUBE https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=77boH2gv-x4&t=272s

BRING: Running shoes, water bottle, tubes, spare wheels or bike if you have them!

It's cyclocross season-ish at The Farm! 

All riders welcome, from beginners and 9 y/o juniors to pro's and master riders. We will split up into groups and tackle skills and do some hot laps. Starting the day with a 2mi run then we are going into skills practice until mid day. The afternoon will be a little more skills work then some hot laps on our private training course. You'll get to ride all of the tough features from our GP Zoe Clay race!

Pro/Elite level riders are welcome, we will have a more “training camp” type schedule for you. Prepare to be beat down! It will be hot, muggy, and difficult. ??

There will be snacks and drinks at the tents. If we get over 30 people registered, I'll spring for some pizza from The Mushroom. Otherwise, bring a lunch.

Categories.CategoryName: Hello I want to do this!

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Come out to a day of learning cyclocross skills with the women of ToBeDetermined and Kruis CX!

The clinic will run from 9am to about 12pm. In the morning we will go over the basics of cyclocross racing, getting on and off the bike, how to corner and ride off-camber. Then we'll break for a snack and a chat with the leaders, who will answer any and all questions about cyclocross, bikes, cycling in New York, riding on trails, or getting into racing generally. 

This is an event for people who identify as femme/trans/women, both adults and juniors. The aim is to grow and promote an inclusive women's cyclocross community in New York. This event is pre-reg ONLY as we cannot accept money on the day of the event.

If registration is a financial hardship please contact the promoter at shaneferro@gmail.com to ask for a reg code. There are plenty of donated registrations to give out, no questions asked!

A cyclocross or gravel bike will be your best equipment option for the clinic, but a road or mountain bike will work in a pinch. If you don't have a bike but are still interested, send us and email and we'll see if we can set you up with a loaner.

Bringing your own snacks and/or lunch is encouraged, but we will have snacks and water on hand.

This event is light rain or shine.

 

Questions? Email shaneferro@gmail.com.

MatchingEvents.EventName: Blunt Park CX p/b Competitive Edge Racing (RVCX Series #1)
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Stop number one of the River Valley Cross Series p/b Shimano!

8/25- Blunt Park CX - Springfield, MA

9/1- Hydra CX - Holyoke, MA

9/28- Kilowatt Cross - Northfield, MA

11/2- Treehouse CX - South Deerfield, MA

 

To promote our local juniors, ALL Juniors get to race for free at Blunt park!

The course will be basically the same great course as in past years with a few modifications.  It is approximate 2+ miles long and is made up of pavement, grassy fields, and single/double track.  It’s flat, fast and has more than it's fair share of turns.  Bring the family as venue is very specatator friendly with a fun atmosphere for the spectators. Also, please be prepared as the park has a nominal parking fee for all vehicles.  

PLEASE PRE-REGISTER! 2nd race only $10.  Field limits 20 min, 75 max for all categories.  

We are offering a Cat 5/Novice field for Men and Women. This field is intended for new riders and racers looking to try out the sport.

DIRECTIONS:

Blunt Park is just minutes from major highways (MA Pike, RT 91 & RT 291).

From East or West: Mass Pike (Rte. I-90) to exit 6 (Route 291).  Take 291 West to Exit 5 (Rt 20 West).  At first lights take a left onto Roosevelt Ave.  Park is about a mile up on the right.
From North or South: Take Rt 91 North or South (depending on direction) to RT 291 East.  Follow 291 East to Exit 5B (Rt 20). At first lights take a left onto Roosevelt Ave.  Park is about a mile up on the right.

CCAP Registered Rider Sign Up (Junior Race AND Junior Practice)
CCAP Registered Rider Sign Up (Open Race AND Junior Practice)

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Day of Registration will be available. Adults are $40 & Juniors are $25.

Day of registration spots are limited to the remaining spaces in each field. We cannot guarantee that you will be able to race.

We are proud to present the Rocky Hill CX Series as a centralized location for our youth teams to practice at (5:00 PM), and a fun, no-pressure, training race for those looking to enjoy cyclocross racing (5:35 PM for the Juniors and 6:15 PM Open Race). Thanks to the Town of Rocky Hill Parks and Rec and our partner clubs for allowing this to happen!

Series Dates:
This 4-week training series will take place on 4 Wednesdays in August/September. August 27th, Sept 3th, Sept 17th, and Sept 24th. With respect to the Town of Rocky Hill and their beautiful park, we will cancel due to rain and wet conditions that will be especially damaging to the venue. In this case, we will provide a credit to all participants and you will be notified of a cancelation via email!

A fun, safe and positive weekly Junior Practice Session
This practice is hosted by CCAP staff and regional team coaches. Licensed junior riders under 18 and middle/high schoolers can enjoy a no-pressure practice session at 5:00 PM. Any junior that wants to ride must be at least 9 years old (cyclocross racing age = age on Dec 31st of the 2024 year) and are welcome to race in the Junior Race. All training activities and races will be started with instruction from CCAP coaches and staff. All youth riders, 18 and under, are welcome to participate in the practice for $10. Riders that are on CCAP registered teams may participate in the practice at no charge.

Fun, safe and competitive racing for all
Fun, friendly, and competitive racing for everyone from novice racers to experienced Category 1 Racers. The wide variety of skill levels makes for an informal, no-pressure vibe. 

All riders must have a USA Cycling License. If you don't have one, one-day beginner licenses may be purchased for $15 and are valid for a single day. One-day beginner licenses may only be purchased by new riders or Category 5 riders.

Volunteers are needed to make this event successful. Sign up to volunteer and you will receive reimbursement on your entry fee. CLICK HERE TO HELP OUT

Equipment
All USAC Rules apply. All riders must wear a helmet. A cyclocross bike or mountain bike (without bar-ends) is suggested. No BMX bikes allowed.

Welcome to the Genesee Valley Cycling Club's Junior Cyclocross Development Program. 

Whether your junior is just starting out on two wheels or looking to mix it up with other riders while tackling obstacles on a race course. There is something for everyone. Our goal is for the juniors to have fun while learning about the sport of cyclocross.

Cyclocross is the perfect way to introduce young athletes to cycling. All events are held off the road, usually in a park setting, where parents can watch and young riders can be safe. The courses include various obstacles such as sand, barriers, and hills that will be fun challenges for young athletes. 

The regional cyclocross race season is almost every weekend from September to December. Race days have a festival atmosphere with competition from beginners to international pros! The GVCC Junior Cyclocross Program will give young athletes an opportunity to learn about the sport, develop bike handling skills, prepare to race in regional events, and most importantly have fun! 

 

CLINIC DATES - Wednesday Nights:


August 27th  ***6:30pm - 8pm***
September 3th 6pm - 7:30pm
September 10th 6pm - 7:30pm 

September 17th 6pm - 7:30pm
September 24th 6pm - 7:30pm

AGENDA:

The juniors will be split up into sub groups based on age and relative ability. Each week, the groups will ride "courses" set up to challenge them with various obstacles often found in cyclocross races. 

Juniors 6 - 10 years:

The U10 group will focus on (1) having fun, and (2) learning bike handling skills, exercising, and getting a taste for competition.

Juniors 11 - 18 years: 

Older juniors will have the opportunity to work on their skills handling various obstacles (sand, run-ups, barriers, Belgian stairs, off camber sections...). We will also mix it up with some intensity and friendly competition.

Other generous sponsors and supporters include:

 

 

     

  

Day-of registration is available on Sunday with a $15 surcharge for adult races. Register today--save yourself time and money. Save your friendly promoters time and energy. We can do this NECX! :)

Come out to enjoy one of the most welcoming and friendly bike races in New England -- home to train primes, Holyoke's muscle beach, and the angry orchard off-camber. 

Race #2 in the River Valley CX Series (@rivervalleycxseries on Instagram)

Details (en español below)

When: Sunday, August 31, 2025

Location: Pulaski Park, St. Koble Drive and Maple St, Holyoke, MA 01040

Day-of-race registration will be available for an extra $15 for all adult categories. Save money, register online before it closes. (Youth races can all be registered for day-of at no extra cost).

New to bike racing?: Hydra Cross is a great event to try out bike racing or cyclocross for the first time. There is a free intro to cyclocross racing clinic at 8:00 am on race day that is taught by local, friendly bike racers. Learn the basics to help you enjoy your race. Beginner races following shortly after -- novice men should sign up for the 9:00 am category 4 and beginner race and novice women should sign up for the 11:00 am women's category 4 and 5 race. Just a note on lingo, brand-new racers and novices start as 'category 5' racers. Since we are a USA Cycling sanctioned race, you will need a license but can purchase one when you register at http://bikereg.com/hydracross for $15. If you have any questions about the clinic or racing, please just shoot us an email at hydracrossrace@gmail.com and we'll respond with what you need. 

Course Description: A fun, fast, twisty course that is primarily flat but has some surprising uphill kickers. After a slightly uphill, wide start from the "Legion Shelf," the course heads towards Holyoke's "Muscle Beach" and the hilly southern end of the park. The course design takes full advantage of the elevation to make riders work–but then also brings rewards with a swooping downhill that cuts back and forth across the hill. We have some stinging off-camber sections that will require your skills, with the most challenging and decisive sector coming at the end of the course (see Youtube videos below for a preview). The course runs the full length of the long, linear park with ample opportunities for spectating, with continuous announcing throughout the race by the voice of NCC Hydra Cross 2025, Jake Kravitz. Mountain and river views abound.

Equipment Recommendation: File treads (if dry) and all-around tires will work well for most riders. The course is a mix of grass, dirt, and some pavement. New to cyclocross? Mountain bikes, in any shape, work fine for getting started racing. Road or touring bikes that allow for 32mm tires also work fine.

Race Atmosphere: Come for the race, stay for the atmosphere. Our beer garden and picnic area are family-friendly. There is a playground, splash pad, and popular skate park as well. Our race is known for its good vibes and community-driven feel. 

The excellent Thai Chili Street Food Hub will be serving food in the American Legion Parking lot at lunch time. As usual, expect the American Legion to be serving up coffee, breakfast items, beer and alcohol throughout the day, in addition to lunch and snack items.

Want to do a second race? Great, the second race is just $15, just register for two races at the same time when you sign up.

River Valley Cyclocross Series

     

Follow @rivervalleycxseries on Instagram for updates and series standings

Volunteer Info

VolunteerSignup - Online volunteer signup sheets - 2025 NCC Hydra Cross signup sheet

In order to bring this race to you again this year, we can't do it without volunteers. Seriously, we can't do it without you, and we appreciate you believing in the value, community, and camaraderie that this grassroots race brings to Holyoke and NECX.

Please sign up to volunteer where you can. Volunteers will receive special “staff only” swag this year!

We pride ourselves on taking great care of our volunteers. Friday course setup volunteers will be provided with lunch. All setup, reg, and course maintenance volunteers will receive a free (refunded) race entry AND invite to the volunteers-only after-party (including a free beer ticket) hosted right on-site at our incredible hosts, the American Legion, at 4:30pm or as soon as the course tear-down is complete.

We need folks to stick around and help us tear down the course immediately after the last race--if you stay to tear down the course, dinner from Pizza d'Action (Holyoke's best, with ample vegan and vegetarian pizzas) will be provided for you on-site while the last race is in progress so that you can stay and help with a full stomach. Volunteers who work registration or course repair jobs during race day will also be provided with lunch.

VolunteerSignup - Online volunteer signup sheets - 2025 NCC Hydra Cross signup sheet

Join the club

Hydra Cross p/b Open Square is supported by the Northampton Cycling Club (NCC). Join in numerous weekly group rides (all ability and skill levels, including gravel rides, cross practices, and practice crits). Learn more about the club and become a member here: https://www.nohobikeclub.org/

 

Media from our 2021 event:

 

 

2021-09-05 Hydra CX from Jeff Dieffenbach on Vimeo.

 

Detalles

Lugar: Parque Pulaski, St. Koble Drive y Maple St, Holyoke, MA 01040

¿Eres nuevo en las carreras de bicicleta?: Hydra Cross es un evento excelente para probar correr en bicicleta o hacer ciclocrós por primera vez. Hay una clínica gratuita de introducción a las carrera de ciclocrós a las 8 am el día de la carrera que es impartida por corredores de bicicleta locales y amistosos. Aprende los conceptos básicos para ayudarte a disfrutar de tu carrera. Las carreras para principiantes empiezan poco tiempo después -- los hombres novatos deberían inscribirse para la carrera de principiantes categoría 5 de las 9 am, y las mujeres novatas deberían inscribirse para la carrera categoría 4 y 5 de las 10 am. Solo un comentario sobre la jerga, los corredores nuevos y los novatos comienzan como corredores ‘categoría 5’. Debido a que somos una carrera sancionada por USA Cycling, necesitarás una licencia, pero puedes comprar una por $15 cuando te inscribes en http://bikereg.com/hydracross. Si tienes alguna pregunta acerca de la clínica o las carreras, por favor envíanos un correo electrónico a hydracrossrace@gmail.com y te responderemos con la información que necesitas.

Descripción del Recorrido: Un recorrido divertido, rápido y sinuoso que es principalmente plano, pero tiene algunas subidas inesperadas. Después de un comienzo levemente cuesta arriba y amplio desde “Legion Shelf”, el recorrido se dirige hacia “Muscle Beach” en Holyoke y hacia el extremo sur montañoso del parque. El diseño del recorrido aprovecha al máximo la elevación para hacer trabajar a los corredores, pero también trae recompensas con un descenso en picada a través de la colina que acorta las idas y vueltas. Tenemos algunos punzantes sectores off-camber que requerirán de tus habilidades, siendo el sector más decisivo y desafiante el que está al final del recorrido (ver el video de Youtube indicado más abajo para una vista preliminar). El recorrido abarca la longitud completa del largo parque lineal, con amplias oportunidades para los espectadores, con relato continuo durante la carrera por la voz de Hydra Cross, Adam Syzmkowickz. Abundan las vistas a la montaña y al río.

Recomendaciones de Equipamiento: Neumáticos con banda de rodamiento lisa (para terreno seco) y multiuso funcionarán bien para la mayoría de los corredores. El recorrido es una combinación de pasto, tierra y algo de pavimento. ¿Eres nuevo en el ciclocrós? Las bicicletas de montaña, en cualquier estado, funcionan bien para empezar a correr. Las bicicletas de carretera o de turismo que permiten usar neumáticos de 32mm también funcionan bien.

Ambiente de Competición: Ven por la carrera, quédate por el ambiente. Nuestro patio cervecero y zona de picnic son aptos para familias. Hay un patio de juegos, juegos de agua y también un parque para patinetas muy popular. Nuestra carrera es conocida por sus buenas vibras y por la sensación de comunidad.

Categories.CategoryName: Training Race for CCAP Coaches and Volunteers

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Day of Registration will be available. Adults are $40 & Juniors are $25.

Day of registration spots are limited to the remaining spaces in each field. We cannot guarantee that you will be able to race.

We are proud to present the Rocky Hill CX Series as a centralized location for our youth teams to practice at (5:00 PM), and a fun, no-pressure, training race for those looking to enjoy cyclocross racing (5:35 PM for the Juniors and 6:15 PM Open Race). Thanks to the Town of Rocky Hill Parks and Rec and our partner clubs for allowing this to happen!

Series Dates:
This 4-week training series will take place on 4 Wednesdays in August/September. August 27th, Sept 3th, Sept 17th, and Sept 24th. With respect to the Town of Rocky Hill and their beautiful park, we will cancel due to rain and wet conditions that will be especially damaging to the venue. In this case, we will provide a credit to all participants and you will be notified of a cancelation via email!

A fun, safe and positive weekly Junior Practice Session
This practice is hosted by CCAP staff and regional team coaches. Licensed junior riders under 18 and middle/high schoolers can enjoy a no-pressure practice session at 5:00 PM. Any junior that wants to ride must be at least 9 years old (cyclocross racing age = age on Dec 31st of the 2024 year) and are welcome to race in the Junior Race. All training activities and races will be started with instruction from CCAP coaches and staff. All youth riders, 18 and under, are welcome to participate in the practice for $10. Riders that are on CCAP registered teams may participate in the practice at no charge.

Fun, safe and competitive racing for all
Fun, friendly, and competitive racing for everyone from novice racers to experienced Category 1 Racers. The wide variety of skill levels makes for an informal, no-pressure vibe. 

All riders must have a USA Cycling License. If you don't have one, one-day beginner licenses may be purchased for $15 and are valid for a single day. One-day beginner licenses may only be purchased by new riders or Category 5 riders.

Volunteers are needed to make this event successful. Sign up to volunteer and you will receive reimbursement on your entry fee. CLICK HERE TO HELP OUT

Equipment
All USAC Rules apply. All riders must wear a helmet. A cyclocross bike or mountain bike (without bar-ends) is suggested. No BMX bikes allowed.

New to cyclocross?
Check out THIS VIDEO to learn what it's all about!

We are happy to announce that the Kings CX Time Trial Series at Kingswood Park will be coming back! 

For over 15 years this series has been a great way for first time and experienced CX riders to come out, train hard and hang with other members of our CX tribe. The format is simple: a local host team sets up an approximately 3 mile "course" using cones to simulate some of the elements of CX. Then we line folks up in rows of 3 and send you off at 15 sec intervals to complete 1, 2, or 3 laps of your choosing. 

Timing:

The "timing Gods" willing, we will hopefully have some sort of time recorded that we can report back to this page later that evening/next day. NOTE:  If you need absolutely accurate training times each week we strongly recommend having your Garmin/Wahoo and ready to go. #glitcheshappen 

More Details:

Dates: Aug 13th, 20th, 27th, Sept 3rd

Registration:  Will be via BikeReg, opening Aug 1 (likely sooner), $15/night,  Look for links to be posted here.

Registration closes at NOON of race day. There is NO on-site registration.

No USAC license required but helmets and a signed waiver (on-line) are required to participate. No exceptions!!

Parents can follow their small juniors but must have a helmet and signed waiver also.

Time:  

5:45 - Number pick up / Pre Ride, 

6:30- Pre TT announcements-Line Up, 

6:45 - First Riders off

 

Distance: 1, 2, or 3 laps of a 2.75-3 mile cone marked loop

Prizes/Podiums: None. Zero. Nada. This is just a training ride....So this is for "personal glory" and all of the fun of playing bikes with your friends in a park until the street lights come on.. 

Special Thank You to: 

Spoken Bicycles/Team Optimist, Bishop Bicycles, Queen City Wheels, and Brilliant Advice Racing + Team Hungry for being our Host Teams this year! You all are the best!

MatchingEvents.EventName: Belltown Throwdown 1 - Classic Course, Race #1 of PMCX
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Stage 1/AirLine Cycles and friends are proud to bring you Belltown Throwdown 1, at the beautiful YMCA Camp Ingersoll.  This is the first of two races hosted by Stage 1 at Ingersoll this year, but rest assured, the two races will be on 100% different courses… and we're not just doing the opposite direction move either! ! 

RACE DETAILS

BE SURE TO PREREGISTER -- DAY-OF REGISTRATION MAY NOT BE AVAILABLE!

We packed as much into this event as we could, and then we packed even more! Like all the AirLine and Stage 1 events, we want Belltown Throwdown 1 to be a fun day of racing AND spectating; that means a fun course full of our trade mark "special features", sweet music, and big prizes.  We're also psyched to be part of the Project Mayhem CX series, which means consistent schedules, neutral support at every race, series prizes, and a cohesive calendar of great events.

What can you expect?  A great course that will be equal parts fun and challenging.  For example, this...

And this...

And this...

And, of course, plenty of this...

What else? How about just $20 for each additional race!

Just a couple of things to note about the event as you're planning to attend.

1.  All dogs must be kept on leash (6 feet or shorter).  No exceptions.  A loose dog is dangerous to itself and the racers.

2.  PRERIDING THE COURSE WILL BE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE OFFICIALS.  THE COURSE MAY NOT BE OPEN FOR PRERIDING BETWEEN RACES.  We tried to build time into the schedule to allow it, but there may not be time.    All prerides must begin AFTER the finish line and you must check with the officials/volunteers at the officals tent to see if it is permitted at that time.  If you are preriding, DO NOT PASS ANY ACTIVE RACERS.  If you pass an active racer, we reserve the right to DQ you from your event and you will not get a refund.  You have been warned.  

3.  Sunrise is at 6:22am.  Course will open for pre-ride at 6:30am and close at 8:10am.  If you want to pre-ride for the morning session, show up early.

4.  In the interest of serving our racers, if you cannot attend we will refund you for any reason at any time up to registration closing.  Email us.  If you wanna make up a funny story, great.

5.  Want to help out?  Sign up to volunteer here by sending us an email.  We'll give you a t-shirt, some snacks and beverages, and unlimited high fives. https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10C0C49ABA629A75-57553048-belltown

6.  We are working on day-of registration.  We CANNOT guarantee it, but we will try, so it is better if you register in advance.  If we are able to do day of registration, there will be a $10 surcharge.  Second race is available for $20 if you want to race multiple categories in a day.

7.  Seeding will be based on: a.  Top 8 from the series b.  Cross-Results race predictor. c. Day of registrations
All mixed gender junior fields will be staged as follows:  Top 8 (front row) will be 50/50 boys and girls by PMCX series standings.  Rest of field will be mixed according to cross results race predictor.

8.  We will be providing FREE photos to racers.  Look for photographer Bill Kurtz out on course throughout the day. 

9.  Cash Prizes: 

5 or fewer | $85 — $65 — $45

6 racers | $85 — $65 — $45

7 racers | $85 — $65 — $45 — $30

8 racers | $85 — $65 — $45 — $30

9 racers | $85 — $65 — $45 — $30 — $25

10 or more racers | $85 — $65 — $45 — $30 — $25

10.  Why are the Open and Womens P123 races different lengths?  Don't you care about equality and equity?  We do.  So much so that we reached out to a handful of elite women to get their opinion, and based on that feedback we made this decision.  Given the constraints of running a whole bunch of categories in the day, and wanting to give women separate time slots from men, what made the most sense for our schedule was to have the P123 women and the 40+ Women share the course and do 50 and 48 minutes respectively, instead of forcing them to race with the men. (we try to make as many people happy as possible.  If you have scheduling suggestions for us that you think would work better, we are always happy to entertain them for next year)

11.  Pain in the Neck CX, like all Stage 1 Cycling and AirLine Cycles events, is an inclusive race environment that is safe and welcoming to all participants, regardless of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, religion, disability, or ethnic origin. Athletes are allowed to compete in the gender category that they identify as. Non-Binary athletes are welcome to compete in the Non-Binary category or any of the Open and Women categories. 

We strive to create an atmosphere that makes all feel welcome. From Pros to first-time racers, from staff to spectators, we will not accept behavior that is deemed to be bullying or any form of harassment and violators will be asked to leave.  

At any point, if you feel uncomfortable or unsafe or see behavior that seems to be making someone else uncomfortable, please speak to an official or staff member. 

12.  We've tried to get all planning done ahead of time, but sometimes things change for one reason or another (often outside of our control).  Please be understanding and flexible with us.  You can help us put on a great event by REGISTERING EARLY!  We have to plan out porto-potties, food, shirts, porto-potties, registration staff, and even PORTO-LETS based on the expected registration…. so if you always register at the last possible second, you may have time to ponder all life's mysteries as you wait in long porto-let lines!  To help encourage this, the first 50 registrants get a nice discount!  

 

Pain in the Neck and the Project Mayhem CX Series are brought to you by: 

STAGE 1 CYCLING, INC.

"The Belltown Original"

Est. 1987

06424

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Welcome back to DFCX for our 9th season of racing at Applegate Deer Farm.

The crew at DFCX are excited to serve up an amazing course and venue for you all!

If you're new to DFCX don't hesitate to sign up.  We provide a fun race environment and try to take the stress off your plate so you can concentrate on your race.

Kids pump track course will be buffed out and dialed for this year.  Check out the schedule with kids races happening a few times throughout the day.  As a parent it's difficult to align mom/dads race to the kids race so we want to provide a few more opportunities.

Location:  101 Applegate Ln. W. Newfield, ME 04095

Registration:  Look for the reg. tent in the middle of the raceway as you drive into the field.

Day-of:  There is day of registration!  BikeReg is open all day on September 6th and you can sign up 30min prior to the start of the race.  You'll sign up on BikeReg as usual.

DFCX Swag:  Don't forget to stop at the swag table to pick up a DFCX hat, tee, or a sweet kit/ vest.  (cash appreciated)

*** Custom  DFCX super clean water bottles from Bivo.

Course:  Open fast sections linked with the perfect amount of flow and tech.  (Grass, gravel, sand, off camber, barriers).

Post Race:  Food and Beer available from 11 am to close.  

Course Inspection:  Course inspection will be open after the last racer starts their final lap.  (PLEASE DO NOT CROSS THE FINISH LINE TO ENTER THE COURSE)  Look for the entrance after the finish line and be respectful to the racers on course, give them 200 meters.

 

Portland Velo Club:  Thank you PVC for supporting local grass roots events.  Your contribution directly feeds the podium for the elite Men and women!

Never done a race? This is the one to try. Seasoned racer? Time to dust off the cobwebs.

Adults race a second time for only $20

JUNIORS! Join  Marian University Students and Alumni, Pro CX racers for a free clinic around the course! 10:30 - free to attend.

On-site registration will be fees above plus $10

Event held under USAC permit 10843 - - all times EST

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Thank you for signing up for our race - we're excited to throw down once again with the Bubblecross gang! As we have updates and news, we'll post to our Facebook and Instagram pages!

NICA juniors 9-12 and 13-14 class - race the juniors class for $15 - no USAC license fee!!!! We will be making a donation to NJ NICA in support of junior MTB racing, as we work to get #morekidsonbikes!

A few housekeeping notes to keep in mind for the event -

  • When parking in the upper parking lot, please respect our neighbors. Please use the provided port-o-johns, and please, do not flash the neighbors! Preferred parking ($) is available in the asphalt lot near registration. Team tent areas will be in the asphalt lot above the pits. Parking passes will be emailed once registration closes. Please print out and have available to show the parking staff when you arrive.
  • Pre-ride is open once the leaders have passed the finish line on their final lap. You MUST enter the course after the finish line, in the finish area. If you are seen by an official or race staff passing a rider who is still racing you will be relegated to the back row of your race.
  • The race director reserves the right to warn or disqualify anyone from an event for unsportsmanlike behavior, including but not limited to: profanity towards volunteers or other riders, foul-riding, throwing your bike, etc. Headphones and other personal listening devices that may interfere with a racers awareness of other riders and their surroundings are prohibited. If you are seen racing with headphones, you will be disqualified. 

CHECK YOUR START TIMES before race day in case of any changes!

This is a USA Cycling regulated event and all USAC and NJBA rules will be followed. Classes may be combined but will not affect your individual standing for the series. Please review all series regulations at https://njbikeracing.com/cups/cyclocross-cup/ .

Payouts!

Men's and Women's Elite A class will have equal payouts based on the number of registrations. The more racers in the class, the more we pay out - so get your friends to come out and race!!

 

We love dogs! Keep 'em leashed and under control at all times - there's no dog class! And goes without saying - clean up after them too, please!

MatchingEvents.EventName: Ed Sander Memorial CX -- Event #1 of the 2025 BikeReg Cyclocross Super Series
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Event #1 in the 2025 BikeReg Cyclocross Super Series

The 21st edition of the Ed Sander Memorial Cyclocross race hosted by Vanish Brewing in Leesburg, VA  

Welcome to the registration page for the 1st event in the CX Super Series!

NCVC Women’s Team Saturday WTFNB Clinic and Pre-Ride (pre-registration required!)

Please join the NCVC Women’s team on Saturday from 3-5 PM for a preview of the course. Pre-registration is required.  This clinic is WTFNB inclusive and is designed for all skill levels. We will focus on specific aspects of the course and practice the basic skills needed for navigating those sections confidently. Participation in Sunday’s race is not required, but we encourage you to put your new skills to the test!

All USA Cycling Cyclocross rules apply:

  • Mountain bikes will be allowed WITHOUT bar ends.
  • Held under USA Cycling event permit 2024-9750.
  • For age-graded races, Racing Age for Cyclocross is defined as your age on December 31, 2025.
  • There will be 1 double pit on the course.
  • Event will be held rain or shine.
  • BikeReg Cyclocross Super Series rules available at https://www.superseriescx.com/

Warmups: The course will be open for inspection and warm-up approximately 15 minutes prior to each event. Warming up on the course during an event is strictly prohibited and will not be tolerated. DQ & forfeiture of entry fee will result.

Staging: all riders will be staged on the grid by bib number.  

  1.  Riders will be assigned bibs in order of their overall ranking on CrossResults.com as of the close of registration.
  2. Riders who are unranked on CrossResults will be assigned bibs in the order of their registration.
  3. All categories that award SuperSeries points may reserve the first four spots in the third row for promoter's discretion call-ups.

Those categories consisting of only category 5 men or category 4/5 women are staged strictly by order of registration. All race day entrants will be staged behind the pre-registered riders, and are not entitled to any special consideration based on to their Super Series points or CrossResults ranking. Full staging details are at https://www.superseriescx.com/.

Results: BikeReg Cyclocross Super Series races are electronically timed by Insight Timing Services. The protest period is a firm 15 minutes from the announcement that results have been posted. Racers are also reminded to make sure their team name is correct in both their USA Cycling profile and their BikeReg profile.  Results will be uploaded with the Club & Team affiliations shown in the rider's USA Cycling profile.

Pit: There will be one double-sided pit on the course. Please remove your equipment immediately following your race to make room for others.

Course Description: The course utilizes the beautiful farmgrounds of Vanish Brewing, with a balance of pavement, grass, and dirt paths and a good amount of elevation gain; bring those climbing legs! Be mindful of the local sheep! 

Spectating: The course has great sight lines and many opportunities for spectators to get a great view of the action. With a full service brewery and food onsite, great ready to enjoy a full day of racing for the whole family! A central announcer will be located near the Start/Finish. 

Registration, Entry Fees, & Licensing:  all registration and payment for this event, including race day registration, will be conducted through BikeReg.  Addtional entries are offered at $20 ($25 on race day) when purchased in the same BikeReg shopping cart.  If the entries are purchased separately during the pre-registration period, contact us for a partial refund; on event day a coupon code will be made available at the day-of registration table to achieve the same discounted price.  Entry fees will increase to $50 for adults and $25 for Juniors for race day registration, to reflect the day-of surcharge.  There will be no in-person sales at the event -- register online, either at home before coming out or on your phone at the event.  You MUST present your racing license (if you have one) or 1-Day receipt in order to be issued a bib, and you should also be prepared to show your confirmation email.  In order to expedite your entry, make sure you have completed the online waiver before approaching the day-of registration table.

This page will re-open for day-of registration by 6 AM;  check-in will open by 7 AM.  Check-in and registration for all races will close 15 minutes prior to the scheduled start of the race.  There will be no exceptions made to this rule -- plan to show up timely for the race you want to enter.

Any current National Cyclocross Champions shall be granted free entry, but must wear their national jersey in the class in which it was won.

A USA Cycling racing license is required for entry.  Riders who do not provide a USAC Annual racing license # at registration will be assessed an additional $15 for a Beginner 1-Day license.  This license is valid for entry only in fields that are open to Novice Men, Women, or Non-Binary riders.  For all other fields, you must present proof of an active USAC racing license (or a printed Authorization to Ride) showing your Cyclocross category and Racing Age.

Charity Donations:  We'll be accepting donations onsite and at https://square.link/u/qyYrST9v for two charities this year.

  • Blessings in a Backpack, Frederick Chapter.  This organization provides food on the weekends for school-aged children who might otherwise go hungry. Read more here: https://frederick.blessingsinabackpack.org/frederick-chapter/
  • Charles B. Thomas Follow Your Dream scholarship.  This scholarship was established at the request of the late Charles B. Thomas, a full-time substitute teacher for eighteen years in the Waynesboro, PA area school district. Mr. Thomas was also the former owner of Lilypons Water Gardens, which was started by his grandfather in 1917. Read more here:  https://core-docs.s3.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/1793644/FYD_.pdf

Full Moon Vista is pleased to bring Ganondagan Cyclocross back for 2025! With great appreciation for our friends at the Ganondagan Historic Site - this event will surely become a fall favorite! Proceeds from this event go to support the Friends of Ganondagan and the NYS Historic Site at Ganondagan.

Complete details can be found on fullmoonvista.com

MatchingEvents.EventName: Sorry Honey, I've Gotta Work Late
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Sorry Honey, I've gotta work late! 

REGISTRATION:
We encourage racers to register early.  We are offering series entry, at a discount, or you can sign up for individual event dates.

COURSE INFO:
All races will be located in Forest Hill Park, Richmond, VA. 

Cross course: the lap will be approximately one mile in length using a combination of surfaces that may include grass, blacktop and dirt.   What type of bike?  We don't care...race your cross, mountain or gravel bike. 

Lapped Rider:  If you are lapped you can continue to race, unlike some cyclo cross races. Once the race leader finishes the required number of laps, remaining riders will will be done once they complete their current lap.  The event will be scored by number of laps completed, then by time.

AWARDS: 
There will be series awards after 3rd race.  To be eligible for prizes, you must enter and race all three events.  

DISTANCE/TIME:
All races will be about 45 minutes.  Our goal is for the 1st pace overall to race close to 45 minutes.  All racers then will finish their current lap once the leader finishes. There will be a countdown lap count at the start/finish.  Lapped racers will not be removed from the course!  All racers will be able to continue to the finish of the event!

NUMBER OF LAPS:
Race organizers will determine numbers of laps based on average time per lap of leaders.  Once laps times are established there will be l lap counter counting down the laps.  This number will be reduced by 1 each time the leader crosses the line.  Note that the number can change by 2 if the leader passes you during any given lap. We will ring a bell for riders to signal "one to go". Historically, the winner completes 11 to 12 laps in the 45 minute window.

 

DONATION:
Donations will go to the local trail working groups (RVA MORE) earmarked to maintain the trails at Forest Hill Park.  Please donate a few bucks during registration.

RAIN OR WET CONDITIONS
To protect/secure our use of the park, we will postpone or cancel a race in the event of rain or wet conditions.  Don't let this prevent you from registering early.  We are happy to transfer fees to another runriderace event.

Course set up
I will be out at the course by early afternoon.  If you are able to come, shoot me an email letting me know you can come and your cell for contact.  We will probably need help right up to race start.

MatchingEvents.EventName: Virginia's Blue Ridge GO Cross - TREK USCX Series - UCI C1/C2
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Online registration for races closes Tuesday 9/9. Day of registration available on site(+$10). 
Virginia's Blue Ridge GO Cross  is proud to be part of the 2025 UCI calendar and TREK USCX Series.

Registration:
Online registration closes Tuesday, September 9th at 11:59 PM (EDT). 

Early registration discount until August 26th at 11:59pm.

 $10 day of(on site) additional registration fee.  Unlicensed, or first time racers will need to purchase a One Day license (per race day) in addition to registering for Category 5 (men/women) or Juniors categories (under 18).  No mail-in registration or refunds.  UCI Elite races are preregistration only and require a valid UCI license.

The Venue:
Fallon Park is home to a permanent cyclocross course.  Our course features "School Hill", a long sand pit, planks, grass, pavement, forced run up (stairs) and more!  
Club Row - Reserve your team's spot(s) inside the event area.
Games and Shenanigans - Tailgate games, lounge pool and ENO hammocks! Beer mile relay, crosstume contest, lil' belgians race, and more.
Music - stay tuned!
Food Trucks: At least two food trucks onsite.

Staging:
UCI events will be staged by UCI points, then random draw.
USAC events will be staged:

  1. Top 5 from 2024 USCX Final Standings (GOCX only)
  2. Pre-registered riders based on crossresults.com rankings
  3. Pre-registered riders without a crossresults.com ranking will be staged by order of registration.
  4. Day of registrations will be staged by order of registration.

Club Row:
Reserve 10x10($100) or 10x20($175) spots inside the race venue(within ABC area) for the weekend.  Club Row spots are preregistration only.  Space is limited.  Teams will need to take down or remove canopy over night in case of high winds/severe weather.

UCI OVERNIGHT PARKING:
This reserves space for overnight parking within the UCI team/rider parking lot.  Overnight parking is ONLY available at Fallon Park for UCI teams/riders that have reserved spots.  Security personnel will be present overnight.

There is no overnight parking allowed at Fallon Park (with exception to reserved overnight parking in the UCI lot).

Additional Notes:

LITTLE BELGIANS kid's race is FREE to kids under 9.  Parents or legal guardians must complete and sign a waiver.

Cyclocross Television coverage from 2019:
2019 Course Walk
ELITE WOMEN Day1
ELITE MEN Day 1

VLOGS:
Kerry Werner [Kona - Maxxis - Shimano] - 2019
Kerry Werner [Kona - Maxxis - Shimano] - 2018
Cody Kaiser [Lange Twins - Specialized] - 2018

For additional questions or information, please visit www.gocrossrace.com or contact Frank Deal at roanokegocross@gmail.com.

Fallon Park is located minutes away from downtown Roanoke and accessible via the Greenway.

Special thanks to Visit Virginia's Blue Ridge, Roanoke Outside Foundation, Avis Construction, Trek Bicycle Roanoke, PROthirteen Coaching, The Black Bibs, Roanoke Parks & Rec, Ropam Enterprises, Freedom First Credit Union, Atlantic Union Bank and all of our volunteers that make GO Cross possible!

Google Map Directions - https://plus.google.com/110901604809032028473/about?gl=us&hl=en

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Guy's Racing Club presents 

Whirlybird 'Cross (Permit #11233)

 at

Twining Valley Park
1400 Twining Road, Dresher, PA 19025

on Saturday, September 13th, 2025

This race is part of the PACX series!

WHIRLYBIRD – PINEAPPLE CRUSH OMNIUM: Are you ready for this? We are trying something new this year and providing a fun and competitive incentive to make the first PACX series weekend a full on racing weekend.  Here’s the rules!

The Omnium will include a racer’s normal category race at both events and participation in the KSC relay race at Pineapple Crush. Points will be awarded for finish placement and raffle tickets will be awarded for each race raced. Additional races will not improve point standings but will earn additional raffle tickets.

Points will be a reverse order points system, so the less points the better. E.g. 1st place = 1 point 2nd place = 2 points and so on. So, the goal is to get the least amount of points. There is no cap on the # of raffle tickets a person can earn. 5 per completed race. Raffle tickets can be collected after the race is completed from registration and there will be a can to drop them in. 

The podium will be all inclusive, there won’t be a male/female podium. Top 3 in the omnium will share a $300 cash prize. Raffle tickets will be pulled after the last race at Pineapple Crush. You do not need to be present to win, but we would love to see you there!  Raffle winners will be notified by email if not present.

If you would like to participate in the W-P Omnium here are the steps:

  1. Sign up for your primary race at Whirlybird and Pineapple Crush, this must be consistent e.g. Women CAT 123 for each race. You can do more races but you must do both your primary.

  2. No relay necessary.

  3. Sign up for the omnium category so we know your competing and can collect raffle tickets!

  4. Race, have fun and collect raffle tickets! 

  5. If you win cash or raffles you do not need to be present to win.  We will notify you via email.

 

Facebook: Like us on Facebook to receive updates and information about the race. www.facebook.com/WhirlybirdCross

Registration: Pre-reg closes Friday September 12th at 5 PM.  Additional races for the day are a $10 registration fee.  Registration will cost an additional $10 on the day of the event, so please pre-register!  Late fees do not apply to juniors.  Day-of we accept cash or checks -- no plastic.

Registration/Sign-in and race number pick up opens on-site at 7:30 AM and closes 30 minutes before each race.

No refunds will be given with the exception of circumstances that fall within those described in "Race Cancellation Policy," below.

Licensing: USAC permit #9706.  All racers (except for the kids race) must present a valid license at registration and sign a USAC event release form. Smart phone license verification will be accepted; download the USAC app for better viewing.

  • Beginner One-Days One-Day licenses for beginner categories are $15 and may be purchased on USA Cycling’s website, or on-site at the event.
  • Experienced One-Days If your categories prohibit you from entering a race with a beginner one-day license (anything but cat 5), you can purchase the experienced one-day license for $35. The experienced one-day license is only available on USA Cycling’s website.

USAC annual license renewals will be available on USA Cycling's website or at the race for $110.

Your cross racing age is your age as of December 31, 2026 (not 2025!).
 
Racers under 18 (real age, not racing age) must also have a parent sign the release form (can bring one pre-printed from the USAC site and signed by the parent if the parent cannot attend the race). Kids racers also need a parent signed release form.

The Venue: Whirlybird 'Cross takes place in Twining Valley Park in Upper Dublin Township, PA.  Located close to PA Turnpike "Exit 343 Willow Grove" and only 40 minutes from Philadelphia and Delaware.  Please see the Upper Dublin Township site for park specific rules and information (Twining Valley Park Development | Upper Dublin, PA (upperdublinrec.net)).

Location: Twining Valley Park, 1400 Twining Rd, Dresher, PA 19025

Pre-riding:  NO PRE-RIDING IN THE PARK PRIOR TO RACE DAY

Equipment: Mountain bikes are allowed as long as they do not have bar ends. No aero bars are allowed.

Clothing: Helmets are required for all riders on bicycles, even when not actively racing (eg, while riding from the parking lot). Per USAC regulations, racers must wear a jersey with sleeves covering the shoulders. No tank tops are allowed. Race radios and earphones for playback (eg, mp3 player) are not allowed while racing.

Staging: All racers should present to the start grid 15 minutes prior to the start of their race. 

Call up Protocol: The call-up protocol will be based on Race Predictor rankings as posted on Crossresults.com, followed by order of pre-registration. ALL CALL-UPS WILL BE BASED ON PRE-REGISTRATION. DAY-OF REGISTRATIONS WILL START AT THE BACK OF THE FIELD. Call-up protocol for the Cat 4/5 Men and 9-14 Men and Women will be based on order of registration. Bib number will indicate your start grid position. NOTE: IF YOU ARE RANKED, BUT DO NOT PRE-REGISTER, YOU FORFEIT YOUR CALL-UP PLACEMENT AND WILL BE PLACED ON THE START GRID BEHIND THE LAST PRE-REGISTERED RACERS.

FOR YOUR BEST POSITION ON THE GRID, PRE-REGISTER!

Lapped riders: Lapped riders will finish on the same lap as the leader. Riders being passed must yield and not interfere with the progress of passing riders. The officials will provide any necessary additional instructions prior to the start (such as whether or not riders will be pulled from the race prior to the end).

Results: The first three finishers of each race should report to the podium immediately after the race for podium photos.  The protest period starts at posting and lasts 15 minutes. It is the rider's responsibility to have all errors corrected during the protest period. After results are final awards will be available at registration.
 

Kids Race: A fun kids race will start at 12:30 pm for kids too young to race on the real course. A parent must sign the event release form prior to the race, and each kid will be given a race number. Pedal bikes or strider bikes are acceptable. All entrants will receive prizes for participation.

Food: Food will be available for purchase.

Restrooms: Park restrooms will be open as well as a couple extra porta potties located next the park restrooms and near the upper corner of the main parking lot.


Race Cancellation Policy: The course is on Upper Dublin Township property. If weather conditions are such that the race would cause significant damage to the property, e.g., heavy rains and water drenched grounds prior to and during the event, the race may be canceled. The race promoter will make every attempt to determine prior to race day if the race needs to be canceled, however, under extreme conditions part or all of the races may need to be canceled on the day of the race. Every effort will be made to hold the race, including making course modifications if necessary. If the race is canceled on the day prior to the race, notification will be sent to all pre-registered racers via email, and via the race's Facebook page. If the race is canceled in part or whole as described, then registration fees, minus Bikereg fees, will be refunded to those racers.

Event Staff:

...and many many Guy's Racing Club volunteers 
This event takes a lot of work to pull off. Please thank the volunteers for making this event possible!

Guy’s Racing Club would like to thank our sponsors:

For more race, sponsor or club information, visit: www.guysracing.org

MatchingEvents.EventName: Pineapple Crush Cross - PACX Series Race #2
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Lucky ?? #4!  Join the crew of Pineapple Crush Cross as we again "takeover" the prestigious Fifth Street 'Cross course to bring you “The Pineapple Crush” for a fourth year. Returning to the course will be some of your favorite race sections as well as some new cross adventures.  We are bringing back the relay race sponsored by PT Bike Fit and the overall omnium with Whirlybird Cross Race happening the day before. See below for more details on the relay race and omnium.

Special thanks to the Emmaus Compost Center for hosting the race. At Pineapple Crush Cross you will find the widest range of features and obstacles including off camber, sweeping and hairpin turns, steps, barriers, pump track section and then there’s the crush ‘em like a pineapple Shimano Hill.   You'll "bust the rust" on ALL your 'cross skills and have the most fun doing it! Whatever the weather, you’re guaranteed to have a great time, racing ‘cross and possibly dancing to DJ Big Daddy Blake’s awesome tunes!

PARKING: Only permitted outside the gates of the Compost Center. We have two places for you to park. 

  1. Klines Lane Parking Lot, 101 Klines Ln, Emmaus, PA 18049. Located next to the Compost Center entrance road. There are also a few spots at the entrance, but space is very limited.
  2. Seventh Generations Charter School; parking entrances on Minor St. and also Klines Ln. Located across the street from the Compost Center.

To get to the course from the corner of Klines Ln and Minor St, you will follow the access road Robert Rodale Way past the gates. The race course, Porto Potties, and registration are all inside the gates.

REGISTRATION: Opens at 7:30 am and closes 30 minutes prior to the start of each race. Same day registration will be available and will be $10 on top of the standard rate. Additional races are $10 each and that is applied during checkout.  No discount code needed. Racing age is determined by your age on December 31, 2025.

CALL UPS: Will be according to your current standings in Cross Results and then order of signup if you have no Cross Results. www.crossresults.com. Last year's PACX winner will get first call up! Since Pineapple bibs will be created prior to the finish of Whirlybird Cross, those results will not be included in Pineapple Call Ups.

LITTLE BELGIANS FUN RACE: Our youngest racers are welcome to test out their legs and cornering skills by doing a few laps of the mini course set up in the soccer field.  The course will be open for practice and play in the morning. The Little Belgium's race will start at 12:30 PM and racers will do 2-3 laps.  This is a very simple course suitable for little ones.

TEAM TENTS: We have space for about (8) team tents near Shimano Hill.  Sign up is in registration and is first come first serve.  Team Tents & Gear will need to be walked/rolled/hand trucked into the Compost Center.

PT Bike Fit RELAY RACE: (with Le Man’s Start) Inspired by the World Championships relay race, we bring you our very own tropical fruit inspired relay race.  Our goal with the relay is to promote greater ‘cross community collaboration and bring together different categories of racers, who would not normally be together, to form a team and work together to compete in relay race.  The relay will be part of the omnium but you don’t need to be part of the omnium to race it.  The relay is FREE!

If you would like participate please follow these steps.

  1. Recruit your team or reg solo.  Teams must consist of (4) riders and at least (1) Masters and (1) Junior the rest of the team is up to you!
  2. Team leaders can register for the relay in bikereg and invite other team members to register.
  3. Let us know what your Team Name is!
  4. Figure out your strategy, what will your line up be?
  5. Free entry

WHIRLYBIRD – PINEAPPLE CRUSH OMNIUM: Are you ready for this? We are trying something new this year and providing a fun and competitive incentive to make the first PACX series weekend a full on racing weekend.  Here’s the rules!

The Omnium will include a racer’s normal category race at both events and participation in the KSC relay race at Pineapple Crush. Points will be awarded for finish placement and raffle tickets will be awarded for each race raced. Additional races will not improve point standings but will earn additional raffle tickets.

Points will be a reverse order points system, so the less points the better. E.g. 1st place = 1 point 2nd place = 2 points and so on. So, the goal is to get the least amount of points. There is no cap on the # of raffle tickets a person can earn. 5 per completed race. Raffle tickets can be collected after the race is completed from registration and there will be a can to drop them in. 

The podium will be all inclusive, there won’t be a male/female podium. Top 3 in the omnium will share a $300 cash prize. Raffle tickets will be pulled after the last race at Pineapple Crush. You do not need to be present to win, but we would love to see you there!  Raffle winners will be notified by email if not present.

If you would like to participate in the W-P Omnium here are the steps:

  1. Sign up for your primary race at Whirlybird and Pineapple Crush, this must be consistent e.g. Women CAT 123 for each race. You can do more races but you must do both your primary.
  2. No relay necessary.
  3. Sign up for the omnium category so we know your competing and can collect raffle tickets!
  4. Race, have fun and collect raffle tickets!
  5. If you win cash or raffles you do not need to be present to win.  We will notify you via email.

MINI VELO TENT SALE: The mini velo tent sale is another new thing we are trying this year.  The goal is to help the community to redistribute good cycling gear, do a little fund raising for IYC ‘cross team and possibly collect some donations to help recycle good gear that would otherwise be sitting in your closet.  It’s easy, you bring 10 new or gently used cycling gear and we will sell it for you for a $5 donation to Independence Youth Cycling ‘cross team.  Whatever is leftover you take back with you or leave as a donation to a youth cycling non-profit.  If you would like to participate please follow these steps.

  1. During check out, register for the Mini Velo Tent Sale category. $5 donation.
  2. Items must be clearly marked with your last name and price that you would like to get.
  3. You will receive a form upon registration confirmation, fill it out and bring it with your items.
  4. Collect your cash and leftover items when you leave. Option includes to donate unsold items to a youth cycling non-profit.

SPECIAL THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS:

DJ Big Daddy Blake will be helping you get in the “race” zone by mixing all the tunes!

 

Podium swag and and other sponsors:

 

 

 

 

Special thanks to Sonia Lloyd for making the awesome race logo!!!!

NOTES: 

  • A tentative map is below.  
  • Please make sure to put trash in the cans or take it with you. 

Want some practice on the course? Looking for a weekly chance to race and sharpen those skills?  Check out the Fifth Street ‘Cross Thursday night series at: https://fifthstreetcx.com.  You can register for a single night, or for the whole series https://www.bikereg.com/fsx  Mark your calendar for October 31st, for Fifth Street ’Cross Halloween Spooktacular.  Gabe and crew convert the Fifth Street course into a haunted 'cross course with thrills, chills and hopefully no spills! Riders not only compete for placement but also for best and most original costumes.
