SINGLESPEED GRAVEL CHAMPIONSHIPS

Pay Nothing. Give Everything.
v.2025.10.04

Take notes…this stuff will be on the final:

  1. The following is tentative until online registration begins and then it will become slightly less tentative.
  2. New for 2025:
    • Shortened route to 55.5 to make it more racy.
    • Back to the Cumming Tap for all the pre- and post-vibes.
    • No Rock Candy Mountain. Sorry, They destroyed it. Plus, I can't squeeze it in given the shorter route.
    • Less heat. Less wind. LIMESTONE 77.7 v2024 was dumb heat and dumb wind.
    • Maybe other stuff.
  3. Pay Nothing. Give Everything. We are keeping the costs low and the expectations high.
  4. We will continue the stupidity of Fixies on Gravel if we can find 3 people dumb enough to signup.  
  5. If you register and later decide not to participate, please edit your entry in BikeReg and move yourself to the category “I'm OUT - I can no longer participate.” Thanks in advance.
  6. Registration is open on BikeReg until a night or two before (and it's free) so no “day of” registration. Renegade if you want but no podium for you. We got stuff to do on race day and don't have time to bend our lives to your poor planning.

Schedule:

  • Saturday, October 4, 2025, Cumming, Iowa, at The Cumming Tap.
  • 9a: check-in at The Cumming Tap and then gather yourself for the best singlespeed gravel race/ride of your life.
  • 9:45a: ease your way to the shiny brand new Cumming Main Street and then to the adjacent gravel Whatever Street for the start line and a few final minutes of self-doubt. Check your tires even though it's too late. Look for people who appear to know what they're doing and go to them.
  • 10a: Give Everything.
  • Sometime later…podiums and championship Wrangler flannel jerseys followed by pride and joy.
  • I MAY DO AN EARLY PACKET PICKUP ON THU EVENING 10/2 FOR THE 4 PEOPLE WHO MAY SHOW UP - STAY TUNED. And we'll probably ride 30 miles of the route and drink beers. And return to The Cumming Tap and drink more beers and eat chips.

Rules (the written kind):

  1. You must be present to win.
  2. Bolt-on aero bars are not allowed.
  3. Singlespeed bikes only.
  4. No outside support unless available to all racers. Racers may support other racers. And probably should.
  5. Each racer must have a pre-assigned friend/enemy to come pick them up in case of an issue. There is no transportation available from the race director. If you don’t show at the finish no one will come looking for you. YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOU.
  6. Fixie people, although not required, please have brakes on your bikes to supplement your massive thighs. 

Route

  1. Routes (subject to change so don't “save to my routes” until you know they are final):
    1. Dry: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/48877149
    2. Wet: https://ridewithgps.com/routes/51924733
  2. Course will not be marked. We will have a crack staff of volunteers at the key spots. Don’t trust the RWGPS ascent estimates cuz they are always low by a gazillion percent (roughly 25%). Plan on 4K feet of climb.
  3. I deleted this because it was dumb. And BikeReg text editor isn't smart enough to renumber the list.
  4. There are ZERO convenience stores on this route, but we'll have a couple spots to breathe life back into yourself with liquids and calories.
  5. There are no formal checkpoints, so you do NOT need to stop anywhere on the course - this is a race with championships on the line! Make sure to cross the various chipless timing mats out there for accurate splits for the real-time closed circuit satellite feed to The Cumming Tap. Wave to the hidden cameras.
  6. Some beautiful B road are on the route. Unless it's beyond dumb wet, there is no alternative route because the roads can be walked on the shoulder and won't be that bad.
  7. The route is hard and you’re dumb to do it. Do not attempt this race unless you have previously ridden a similar distance on singlespeed on hilly gravel and not died. Not kidding…it is hard.
  8. Tires & gravel conditions…the gravel roads on the route are LIMESTONE with a firm base so you don’t need big ‘ol tires unless you like how they roll. No sandy/pebble roads. The B roads are dirt and fast when dry - just gotta be careful of washouts/ruts. Most racers will be on 33-42c tires setup tubeless of course. There will likely be fresh gravel here and there to dash your hopes and sidewalls.
  9. Chipless timing provided by Sundial Chrono.

Quitting:

  1. Call/text your pre-assigned friend/enemy to come get you because no one else will.
  2. Call/text Chris Kyhl so he also knows you’re OUT @ 515-554-7024.
  3. No one who does this race is a quitter. Unless you quit. Consider chasing the DFL Championship Jersey instead.

Podiums:

  1. Big budget podiums with trophies to write home about. Fastest person in each cat is the champ. That’s how bike races work.
  2. DFL Champ. Finish DFL without cutting course or getting a ride or any other sort of cheating and win a Wrangler champ jersey just like the winners which clearly indicates you were DFL. Wear around town amongst your gravel singlespeeding circle and impress those losers. You clearly worked harder than anyone else and deserve a DFL Champ jersey more than the overall winner. Mainly because they won and you were DFL. I’ll have to put some kind of time cut-off with this otherwise the fixies will track stand all night just before the finish line. I’m thinking a 6hr cutoff maybe, we'll see.
  3. KOM. This is a sore spot. Warren County obliterated Rock Candy Mountain one week after v2024. I'll figure out a way to kudo the best climber. Probably a set of the 3 toughest Strava segments (gotta post “Public” so we can all see). 

SPONSORS: Bob & The Cumming Tap, Half Link Chains, Cedaero Up Nort, Madison County DOT - Gravel Division, Paul Component Engineering, Third Stall, Chumba Bikes, Cal’s See ‘Em & Carbon Ate, The Box Car on the SouthSide, Inner Circle Banquet Room, Surly Gas Pipe Bikes, Warren Co Rollin Coal Local 152, SXSW Corner Bar, Dugout 2.0, The Widow Maker Backwards, White Industries Freewheels, B&B Grocery, Beer Bridge Consortium, Bolt-on Hubs ‘n More, Square Taper Inc, TugNuts, Paragon Machine Works, Creaky EBB’s, Track Ends, and Northwoods Coyote Den on the Bushwhack.

Limestone // Pay Nothing. Give Everything.

MatchingEvents.EventName: Fon Solo Gravel/Last Standing/Cider Cross (Maine Gravel Series)
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Read course updates in bold below. 

Join us for year number three of the Cider Cross/Fon Solo weekend!   

So forget the pumpkin spice, we've got a sour batch of apples ready to be mashed starting with Cider Cross, short track mtb, and trail running on Saturday and finishing with the Fon Solo Loop on Sunday. This two-day event is open to everyone and anyone, with categories for racing, riding and camping. Choose one or all, there'll be good times all around! 

If you've been thinking about 'cross, then don't miss this! This year, we'll have one 40 minute race but will have cyclocross AND mountain bike categories. This year's course will be approximately one mile with a couple of reroutes from last year to create another fast/open section.  (update, the new course is set and features faster sections to work better for slow turning gravel bikes) Bring whatever bike you got and get ready for a whole lotta slop. Trash-talk and heckling encouraged...You get the idea. The fire jump will be back this year for those so inclined… (Prizes for the top three finishers in each category tbd).  

The cross/mtb races are followed by a last-man standing style running race on the cx course.  Runners will need to complete each lap in a certain amount of time.  Lap length will be approximately 1 mile.   The time allowed per lap will drop by one minute per lap.  Pending a few test laps, we’re expecting the first lap to have a 20 minute time limit.  The second lap will have a 19 minute limit, the third 18 minutes… the goal is to allow all runners to get at least a few laps in but keep this from turning into a 24 hour race!  I’m not a particularly talented runner, but expect to get around 7-8 laps in with my 12-minute mile pace…If unfamiliar, you can find out more about the format here:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backyard_ultra#:~:text=The%20backyard%20ultra%20or%20last,remains%20to%20complete%20a%20lap .  

There will be food and drinks for purchase available all day, with plenty of room for camping once the fire dies down. *Be sure to choose a spot from the list above if you plan on staying the night (BYOBreakfast:).

For our grand finale, we have put together a killer ride through the Sheepscot Valley, the Fon Solo Loop. There will be two course options this year (roughly 49 miles and roughly 25 miles) each serving up a mix of sweeping views, picturesque gravel roads and...CHUNKY GRAVEL CLIMBS. You know how we do!  The route will be largely the same as last year but expect a few minor changes/improvements.  The short course is easier and shorter this year eliminating the biggest climb from the last two years and some tricky technical sections. Both routes pass through (as in, you cross their tasting deck…) Oxbow Brewing near the end of the ride and they will be open and pouring for those so inclined…

So round up the troops and get signed up before we're sold out, this one's gonna be gooooood. Best part, proceeds go to The Schmid Preserve in Edgecomb!

P/B: Cannondale, Honey Stinger, Rudy Project
 

Technical Guide


Racing at Crossasaurus Awesome will make you AWESOME. Racing anywhere else will not make you awesome. 

The Venue:  The race will be held on the grounds of the Upper Salford Township park.

PRE-RIDING IS NOT PERMITTED PRIOR TO THE DAY OF THE EVENT.

Note:  Please register online to avoid paying the additional $10 day of race registration fee.  Late fees do not apply to the Junior category.  Late registrants - please complete a 2023 USA Cycling Event Release Form before proceeding to the sign-in line. 

A portion of the registration fees are used to maintain the park for future events.
Look, we'd rather not take your late fees. Please pre-reg if possible!
$5 discount on second race entry for the same registrant.

On-site number pick-up and same-day registration will be available at the registration table. Same-day registration and packet pick-up is open from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm and closes 30 minutes prior to the start of each category race. Riders must present themselves at the Rider Assembly Area/Start Grid 10 minutes prior to the scheduled start of their race.

U19 Girls: Your registration fees have been covered by Befitting Bicycles. You race for FREE. Tell your friends! #growthesport

BACK AGAIN: The Crossosaurus Awesome Single Speed CX Race. ($15 only Race, $10 if you're racing earlier in the day) Use Code "SSRACE2" to receive the discount. 

 

NO REFUNDS WILL BE GIVEN!!! 


Sorry not sorry, Haterz.

Licensing Requirements:   This is a USA Cycling sanctioned event – Permit # Applied. All riders must present a valid license at registration and sign an event release form (minors must have a parent/guardian sign).  One-day and annual licenses will be available for purchase at registration. Current USAC Fee Schedule here. https://usacycling.org/memberships-old/one-day-licenses

Call-up Protocol:  Call ups will be given based on PA Cyclocross Series Standings and rules. Above all we will use promoters discretion. If you yell at the promoter you will go to the back. 

Lapped Riders:  Lapped riders will finish on the same lap as the leaders.  Riders in danger of being lapped must yield to oncoming racers and are not to interfere with their progress or trail behind them. Laps are pretty fast on this course, and come in around 7-8 minutes. We'll try not to pull riders if we don't have to.

Results:  Results will be posted at the registration area.  Results will be made final 15 minutes after being posted.  The top 3 finishers in every event must report immediately to the start/finish line for awards and photos.

Note:  The course will be open for inspection and warm-up at approximately 8:00am. 

* Cash prizes: We don't cut payouts, we are not haterz. Like seriously ever. EVER.

** Promoter reserves the right to cancel events, combine events, postpone events to a later time, make you ride the course backwards, give head starts to slower guys, etc etc etc....

Start times are approximate. Races will start 10 mins. after the preceding event.
Riders warming up on course during an event will be DQ'd. No Exceptions!
Mountain bikes will be allowed WITHOUT bar ends.  No aero bars, in general but specifically for cx.

Inclusivity Statement: We really only have one rule on Ciclismo, and it's “don't be a jerk”. Nobody remembers whether you won some race or not, but they will remember forever if you were not nice to them. In the effort to make cyclocross an inclusive space for new and seasoned participants, we welcome all to join us at our events, and will not tolerate hate (actual hate, not to be confused with haterz) disrespect, bigotry, racism, transphobia, or anything else that has no place in modern society, let alone a grassroots bike race. Should you have an issue with any of these on race day, we have your back. 

Medical/First Aid:  In the unfortunate event of an emergency dial 911.  A First-Aid kit will be available for treatment of minor injuries. EMT will be on site.

Event Contact Information:  For additional information, contact Craig LeBair & Mike Festa at
ciclismocross@gmail.com

Directions: 

http://www.uppersalfordtownship.org/pages/parks_recreation.php

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Welcome to Revenant Cross Weekend where cross is boss! ATC Racing is carrying on the tradition of the race formerly known as “Cross of Ages”. The race is held at Richard Moya Park in Austin, TX and is the series and season opener!

 

Costumes are highly encouraged! This event features a fun and challenging course with off cambers, climbs, and fast flowy sections!  This is a very spectator friendly venue where fans can see the entire race and cheer racers on, or give them some friendly heckling.

 

Whether you're a seasoned racer or brand new to the sport, we've got a race category for you. All are welcome. 

 

Cyclocross is a great way to improve your bike handling skills, learn something new and challenging to add to your skillset, and have an absolute blast while you are doing it.  

 

Sign up today, and tell your friends. You don't want to miss Revenant Cross Weekend! 

 

Race rules:

  1. Don’t be a jerk.
  2. Abide by all USAC cyclocross rules.
  3. The promoter’s ruling is final.
  4. Gravel and mountain bikes without bar ends are allowed. No maximum tire widths enforced. 
  5. Please inform the finish line judges if you withdraw from the race. 
  6. Awards will be awarded 3 deep in competitive categories. Depending on field size, promoter may expand to 5 deep.
  7. Please patronize our sponsors.
  8. You must check in with the registration staff to be counted in the results.

Entry Fees

Entry fee is $40 for your first race and includes any additional races on the same day (ex. Novice riders may also enter the 3/4 /Novice field on the same day at no additional cost).  Note: You must register for these at the same time to take advantage of this discount.

 

Late and on-site registration will be available this year. Entries after midnight on Thursday 10/2 will incur a $10 late fee and may not be included in call-ups. Registration closes 30 minutes before each race wave, so we highly encourage you to sign up as soon as you can!

 

Call-ups will be by crossresults.com.

 

Racing Licenses

All competitive categories require a USA Cycling license to participate.  If you do not have a current USAC annual license you can purchase one at memberships.usacycling.org. First time members can use the code “INTROMEMB25” to sign up for $49. Members of a USA Cycling-registered team can use code “TEAM25” to save $10 on your annual membership. Licenses are good for a period of one-year and covers road, mountain, track and cyclocross racing.

 

Parking and Directions

Ample parking is available in the lots at Richard Moya Park for no additional fee. Please respect park speed limits and be cognizant of bicycles and pedestrians inside the park. 

 

Weather

The event is rain or shine. Delays or cancellations may be issued at the discretion of the promoter or race officials in the event of severe weather.

 

Mechanical Support

Austin Tri Cyclist will be on-hand with neutral mechanical support all weekend. Conveniently located near the pit in case you need any mid-race fixes.

 

Sponsors: 

 

Food and drink

TBD

2024 BOSSCROSS p/b 545 Velo | Sat Oct 5, 2024

Middlesex County 4H Fairground at 55 S Chelmsford Road in Westford MA 01886

545 Velo values diversity and representation and works toward inclusivity in our sport

Event Flier (PDF) | Tech Guide (PDF)

Event Description: The BOSSCROS5 p/b 545 Velo cyclocross race will be held at the Middlesex County 4H Fairground located just 20 miles from the I-95/Route 2 exchange. In addition to scintillating racing, the grounds include ample parking and proper restrooms. Planned amenities include timing by Atwood Racing Services, neutral pit support from Abby Velo, a Kids Race and a club/sponsor tent row.
Please note that the facility prohibits alcohol sales/consumption.

Course Description: The course will grace the field and tree section of the fairground, which traces its “Head, Heart, Hands, and Health” heritage back 60 years. The roughly one-and-a-quarter mile lap eschews elevation in favor of power sections, technical turns, planks, and a set of Belgian steps that only the best dare to ride. Staging will be by Crossresults.com ranking, then order of registration.

Registration: Registration is on BikeReg at https://www.bikereg.com/bosscross (online registration closes at 5pm on Friday Oct 4). Racers may register for second and additional races at $15 each. Day-of registration is an additional $10. USAC one-day licenses can be purchased for $15.

Contact Information: Director: Chad Gibson, chdgibson@yahoo.com | Bike Reg Administration: Jeff Dieffenbach, deepbrook@gmail.com

Welcome to the 11th Annual Keene Pumpkin Cyclocross Race on Sunday, October 5th.  The event is held at the Surry Mountain Recreation Area just outside of Keene in Southwest NH.  The race is on Surry Mountain lake with beautiful  hillside vistas during what is typically peak foliage for the region.  The wildly popular course has a paved starting grid, run-ups, sand, barriers, a woods loop single track section, and and many fast flowy sections.  The course requires a great balance of bike handling and fitness but is not too challenging for juniors or novice racers.  Keene Pumpkin Cross is typically part of the Eastern Collegiate Cycling Conference (ECCC) CX race series bringing collegiate racers from all over the Northeast.  

We will also host the NH State Cyclocross Championships.

The race is also a Junior friendly event with a separate junior field & start time, 3 cub junior age groupings for both boys & girls, a longer 15-18 race, and ½ price entry fees.  

We host a Kids Fun Race!   Bring out your younger non-racing kids (typically 10 or under) to enjoy a few laps on a smaller section of the course.  The kids will race for approximately 10 minutes allowing the older & stronger kids to get in a couple laps while the strider bikes get in one lap.  Their are no placing or podiums but everyone gets a treat at the end.

The race proceeds support the local Keene High School Nordic Ski Team.  The majority of the race leadership and volunteers are athletes, parents, and friends of the local high school Nordic skiing community.  

Follow us on social media for event updates: 

  • Facebook
  • X
  • Instagram

Detailed Venue and Registration Information

  • Venue will open at 7:00am
  • Pre-registration opens at 8:00am
  • Day of Registration is available with a $10 Day of fee
  • Second race entries are available for an additional $10.  
  • Novice one-day licenses may be purchased with your registration for $15 and are valid for a single day of racing.  Experienced one-day licenses must be purchased on-line through USA Cycling.
  • Masters Fields are  open to all categories
  • The 3 Mens Masters fields and Cat 5 women will have separate starts separated by 1 minute
  • All USAC rules apply - USAC approved helmets are required 
  • Payouts for Men/Women 1/2 Races:  $250/3 deep
  • Pre-registration ends Friday, October 3rd at 10:00pm.  
  • Callups will be based on crossresults.com for all pre-registered riders. Day of Registrations will be staged in back.
  • NH  State Championship award eligibility: NH resident and USAC annual license holder racing in eligible race (see above)

We will host the 2025 New Hampshire Cyclocross Championships.  The following Gold, Silver, and Bronze championship medals will be awarded:  

  • Mens & Womens Overall NH State Champion
  • Mens & Womens U23 NH State Champion
  • Mens & Womens Junior NH State Champions in 11-12, 13-14, 15-16, & 17-18 age groups
  • Mens & Womens Masters NH State Champions in 5 year age groups start at age 40.

State Championship Details:

  • Mens overall NH state champ and U23 will come from the Cat 1/2 & Cat 3 race
  • Men's 15-16, 17-18 will be awards from the 15-18 race.  
  • Women's overall, U23, 15-16, 17-18 and Masters  (5 yr increments from 40+) will come from the combined 1/2/3 and 4 and 15-18 field as they have the same start time.   If you place in the overall top 3 or U23 you are then not eligible for age group podium (For example...if you are 41 and place 2nd on the overall podium you will not also win the 40-44 catagory).  
  • You need to be a NH resident and hold an annual USAC license to be eligible. 
  • No state medals will be awarded from the Cat 4 or Novice races.

Eastern Collegiate Cycling Conference (ECCC) Cyclocross Series:  If you are a current full-time student at an ECCC school, you are eligible for competition in the series. Collegiate riders racing within the 1/2 (Collegiate A), 3 (Collegiate B), or Cat 4/5 u40 (Collegiate C) races and will be scored both within those fields and within their corresponding collegiate categories. To be eligible for collegiate scoring, riders must register under their proper collegiate team name and race in their collegiate team kit.

 

Course:

The course evolves every year but has proven to be a popular track over the past several years.  The course is typically 2.5K in length requiring a balance of technical skills and pedaling fitness.  Nothing is too challenging for juniors and novice riders.   We run the course clockwise with a paved start, nice flowing hill section, 2 run ups, 1 technical descent, a fun wooded single track section, one set of barriers and a lot of sand.  A little bit for everyone…. There is a 2-sided pit but no water access for bike washing.  

The course will be set between 10am and 2pm on Saturday.  Please feel free to come help with course set up.  Course pre-ride will be available Saturday after 2pm.  Please park at the entrance above the gate to the venue -  even if gate is open.  We will lock the gate when we leave and don't want cars trapped behind the locked gate.

Food:

  • Bagels and coffee from The Works will be for sale in the morning
  • The AlpineGlo Farm food truck will have lunch foods for sale during the day.  AlpineGlo Farm is a small first generation farm located in Westminster, VT.  They currently raise pigs and chickens to supply their Mexican inspired food business.  Their current focus is to make sustainably prepared foods, all made with the best ingredients from Westminster farmers.  They are committed to small scale farming, animal welfare, and nutritious foods.  The menu will have chicken, beef, pork burritos and tacos along with Rachel's famous CX cookies!!

Directions to event:

From 91 (from Western MA or coming South):

Exit at Brattleboro (Exit 3) for 9W toward Keene.  Straight through roundabout.  Continue on Rt.9 headed West until Rt 9 & 10 & 12 combine and turn left.  Make left turn.  At Y - stay on Rt 12.  Take 1st exit (Maple Ave).  Right at bottom of ramp.  At roundabout, take 2nd exit (Rt 12A) toward Surry.  Race will be at Surry Dam Beach.  Turn right at Surry Dam Beach (venue) sign after a few miles.

From 12N (from Eastern/Central MA):

When entering Keene, Rt12 will merge with Rt10 - turn left at stoplight. Follow signs to stay on Rt12. Will turn right at stoplight in a few miles.  At Y, stay on Rt12 (left).  Take 1st exit (Maple Ave).  Turn right at bottom of exit.  At roundabout take 2nd exit onto 12A North toward Surry.   Race is at Surry Dam Beach.  Turn right at sign into Surry Dam Beach (venue) in a few miles.

From Rt9 South ( from Concord/Central NH toward Keene):

Before entering Keene, take Rt 12 North exit (follow signs).  Take 1st exit off of Rt 12 (Maple Ave).  Turn Right at bottom of exit.  At roundabout, take 2nd exit onto Rt12A toward Surry.  Follow for several miles to Surry Dam Beach (you will see sign). Turn right at sign into Surry Dam Beach (venue).

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Please help make this event happen, volunteer HERE!

ABOUT THE CCAP
The Connecticut Cycling Advancement Program (CCAP) is an organization whose goal is to improve the lives of Connecticut's youth and young adults through the sport of cycling. With the help of more experienced riders, the CCAP supports young people in cycling from our state's high schools all the way to the top of the sport. Cyclists of all ages and skill levels are invited to become involved today!

THE VENUE
The Second Company Governor’s Horse Guard (2GHG) is one of four companies of organized militia within the Connecticut Military Department. Chartered in 1808, in New Haven to protect and attend the governor in times of peace, and war, the unit is one of the oldest continuously mounted cavalry units in the United States.

Google Maps address:
4 Wildlife Dr. Newtown CT 06470
Second Company Horse Guard Stables

PLEASE:

  • No dogs.
  • No course inspection on Saturday.
  • No course inspection while other riders are racing.

THE DETAILS

Day of registration is available. Adults: $50 cash or $55 Venmo; electronic registration forms, please bring your cell phone to registration. Juniors: $30 or $35 with Venmo. Please pre-register!

All USA Cycling Rules Apply.

You may only enter the course for inspection after the winner of the previous race has finished, and the Chief Referee has indicated that the course is open. Riders inspecting the course who pass any rider still competing may lose call-up position or be disqualified.  

One-day Beginner licenses may be purchased in certain categories for $10 and are valid for a single day of racing. One-day Beginner licenses may only be purchased by Category 5 men and women, for use in races open to those categories.
Registration will open at 7:00 a.m. and closes 10 minutes before each race.

Staging for all races will be by CrossResults.com points.
Mountain bikes without bar ends are allowed.  Helmets are mandatory.
* 19-year-olds can compete in the 15-18/High School category, if they are currently enrolled in high school, registered in a high school cycling team, registered to race in the 15-18/High School category, and wearing their high school cycling team jersey during the race.

Welcome to the 29th season of the NCCX series.  We are excited to have you racing. This season's race schedule has a few changes.  If you have questions at the races, please look for our friendly NCCX Ambassadors located at registration and around the race course. From beginner to experienced racers, there are opportunities for all to participate and compete. 

Registration- All registrations will be online. There is a discount for pre-registration, and we encourage everyone to choose this option. Race day registration is available and will be online via your mobile device. 

Race Numbers- If you did not participate in the first race of the season, you must purchase a 2025 race number; the race number fee is included in registration. If you have a 2025 race number, a discount will be applied to your entry fee. Please save your number and adhere your timing chips carefully to the top of your helmet. Race numbers are made of fabric and will be used throughout the season. If you lose or forget your race number, there is a $5 replacement fee.

Refunds of registration- There will be no registration refunds.

If you are Cat 4 or above then you must purchase an experienced one day license online through USA Cycling. The Race Director and Race Officials reserve the right to cancel and/or modify segments of the event as deemed necessary for safety. There is no rain date for this event. Severe weather may cancel race.     

 

Registration:

On-Line Registration until Friday, October 10th at 8:00 pm or day of registration up until 30 minutes prior to your race. Day of registration is $40 for the first race and $10 to add additional races.

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Technical Guide

https://www.englewoodevents.com/cx/cx-tech-guide

Start Order

  • Start order for USAC amateur races determined using crossresults.com points. UCI rankings will be used for UCI categories.
  • Only  pre-registered riders are included. Day of registrants will not be considered in start order.

Licensing:

  • A USA Cycling license (road or mountain), UCI or one-day license is required for all races.
  • ONEDAY beginner licenses only valid for USAC Juniors, Cat 5 Men and Women, and Single Speed fields. ONEDAY beginner license are not valid any other fields.
  • ONEDAY licenses can be purchased through online registration or at the event for Category 5 Men, Category 5 Women, Single Speed, and USAC Junior races. ONEDAY Beginner license fee for 2024 is $15!
  • When registering with a ONEDAY beginner license, enter ONEDAY in the license number field.
  • USAC does allow experienced rider to purchase a ONEDAY experienced rider license for $35 in order to race your category without purchasing an annual license. Experience rider One-day license must be purchased through USAC's website and must be purchased per DAY.
  • All other fields must have an annual license number - and have appropriate cyclocross category.
  • If you are registering with an INTL UCI license, please include your 11-digit UCI code when completing your registration.
  • A UCI International license is required for the UCI Juniors, Elite Men and Elite Women's races 

Juniors - USAC fields:

  • A parent or guardian must have signed a release form for each race day.
  • Entry fee is $25 in advance. Juniors must have a ONE DAY ($15) license for each day racing day or an annual license. 

Equipment Requirements:

  • USA Cycling helmet rules apply.
  • Non-UCI fields can ride cyclocross or mountain bikes (bar ends must be removed)
  • Disc brakes are acceptable.
  • UCI equipment rules apply to UCI fields.

MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Race #2 and 3 in the CBRCX Series Sponsored by Unified Beer Works! Uncle Sam Grand Prix is NY’s longest-running cyclocross race and is back again with TWO DAYS of racing for 2025! Part of the rebranded CBRCX Race series. Hosted in Troy, NY, and centrally located between NYC, New England, and Western NY. 

Discounted $10 registration fee for a second race on the same day.  
 

Uncle Sam 2021 Video by Wild Line Productions
 https://vimeo.com/637886556

 

Rules and Race Information

 

Call ups

All races will be called up based on their crossresults.com points, starting 10 minutes prior to the scheduled start.

Cat 4/5 & Juniors 16-18

Just like the Masters Men, the Cat 4/5 and Junior 16-18 fields will be seeded by their combined crossresults.com points, will have one start, and will be uploaded to crossresults.com as one set of results. This will make sure that everyone can get crossresults.com points, and the points reflect the race. Age filters are available on crossresults.com under the results. There will be two podiums reflecting the finish in each field.

Men Cat 3/4 & Masters Men

All four fields will be seeded by their combined crossresults.com points, will have one start, and will be uploaded to crossresults.com as one set of results. This will make sure that everyone can get crossresults.com points, and the points reflect the race. Age filters are available on crossresults.com under the results. There will be four podiums reflecting the finish in each field.

Junior Races

New this year, kids who are 6 years old (real age on the date of the event, not racing age) can race! They must be on pedal bikes and be able to complete the course unaccompanied, but will have their own results and podiums!

Oh, and the fine print:

All USA Cycling rules apply, including:

  • No sleeveless jerseys, aero bars or extensions.
  • Mountain bikes welcomed with bar ends removed.
  • Riders must wear a CPSC certified helmet
  • Racers must have either a USAC or UCI Racing License. One-day licenses are available during registration or online for all fields through USA Cycling.

New for 2025: The Buffalo cyclocross promotors have teamed up with The Campus Cycling Collective to bring you The Rust Belt Ruckus! : A Buffalo Cyclocross Series This will be race 2 of 5 in the series. If you'd like to register for the full series to save a few bucks and get all your registrations done in one shot, please go HERE! (Registration for series closes 10/1/25)  

 

After a few years off, Knox Farm CX is back! I'm excited to bring cyclocross racing back to this venue!

Parking:

All participant and spectator parking is across Knox Rd in the lot by the soccer fields. Please us caution when crossing Knox Rd to enter the park. Look both ways and keep an eye out for traffic.

Start/Finish Location:

The race will start on the pavement near the old horse stables, straight down the paved path once you enter the park.

Help Spread the word! Tell your teammates, family, and friends! Lets bring the energy and make this event one to remember. Whether they race, cheer, or just come for the good vibes, everyone's welcome!

Welcome to the 29th season of the NCCX series.  The race schedule this season has a few new categories to better serve racers. We are excited to once again provide fun, competitive cyclocross racing across the state. From beginner to experienced racers, there are opportunities for all to participate and compete. 

Registration- All registrations will be online. There is a discount for pre-registration; we encourage all to choose this option. Race day registration is available and will be online via your mobile device. 

Race Numbers- If you did not participate in the first race of the season, you must purchase a 2025 race number; the race number fee is included in registration. If you have a 2025 race number, a discount will be applied to your entry fee. Please save your number and adhere your timing chips carefully to the top of your helmet. Race numbers are made of fabric and will be used throughout the season. If you lose or forget your race number, there is a $5 replacement fee.

Refunds of registration- There will be no registration refunds.

MatchingEvents.EventName: Falkorburg Cross -- Event #3 of the 2025 BikeReg Cyclocross Super Series
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
***BIPOC Discount Code: As part of BBWR's continued mission to support underrepresented riders in racing, we are offering free entry to BIPOC riders. Use coupon code RIDEON2024.***
This year we're offering free entry for all U-19 Girls races thanks to Befitting Bicycles and P. Flanigan & Sons

Event Name: Falkorburg Cross, Event #1 in the 2024 BikeReg Cyclocross Super Series

Hosted by Baltimore Bicycle Works Racing

When: Sunday, September 15th, 2024

Venue: Berg Farm, STM Coaching, Stevenson, MD 

Venue Address: Please follow these coordinates to the parking area, 39°24'47.0"N 76°42'54.5"W, Stevenson, MD 21153.  

Parking & Gear Drop-off: There is limited parking on site at the venue (yellow in the image below), carpooling is encouraged. There will be a gear drop so bikes, gear, and people can be dropped off as close to the action as possible. Navigation to race and the gear drop is best using the following coordinates:  39°24'47.0"N 76°42'54.5"W  Entrance for the drop-off and parking is off of Stevenson Rd. Between Valley Acres Dr. and Old Valley Rd. just past the Stevenson Village Shopping Center. The overflow parking will be at the Stevenson Village Shopping Center itself; however we've never needed to use it. Parking opens at 6:30am.  Draft course map.

 

Gender Equality & Transgender Policy: Classes designated “Masters” are open to Men and Women. Minimum Racing Age and categories quoted are for Men; please see the current USAC Rulebook for minimum Racing Age and categories for Women.  The Super Series  welcomes everyone to participate in the gender category they feel is most appropriate to them, as described in USA Cycling policies: https://usacycling.org/about-us/governance/transgender-athletes-policy.

or

The Venue: The home of Falkorburg Cross, Berg Farm, is nestled in the picturesque valleys of Baltimore County. It features a historic stone barn which holds registration and will shelter anyone looking for cover. As usual we’ll have a food truck and beer garden to keep you fed and hydrated. 

*While usually open to the public, the course will be closed beginning Friday, Sept. 13th for course prep and will re-open on race day.

**Pre-ride opens at 7:30 am on the day of the event with the first race starting at 8:00am.  Warming up on the course during races is not permitted. All USAC rules apply.

 

The Course: The course is located on the Berg Farm in Stevenson, MD. This is a dedicated cyclocross course that is available for practicing throughout most of the year. Waivers are available on-site and required for anyone interested in scouting the course outside of set-up weekend and event day. However, we will have a few tweaks up our sleeves specifically for race day. The terrain is fast and flowing with a number of technical turns and short super punchy climbs. You won’t find any Belgian walls here, but you’ll find plenty of off-camber and twisty turns. 

The flyover is back this year! All fields, adult and junior, will pass over (and under) the flyover. We've added rungs along the left side of both the climb and descent to provide optional additional traction to anyone walking the feature. To walk, run, or ride is a common decision a rider makes when navigating any cyclocross course feature. Please remember to ride within your abilities, stay safe, and keep the rubber side down. 

Rest assured, the balance between power and technical will make this course a leveled playing field.  

 

Spectating:  The venue features easy access to all course locations.  Want to see your favorite rider zoom around the course and navigate the technical turns? No problem! You can enjoy a tasty beverage by team sponsor Peabody Heights Brewer, and watch the ‘cross action’ unfold from one central location or investigate the many prime areas throughout the course for great spectating and friendly heckling. Bring your chair and your ID, and stay around to watch the elite field fly through the course. Bringing the kids? We’ll have 10a.m. and 12p.m. Little Belgians races for the wee little ones age 9 and under. Top it off with food and coffee from local vendors. 

 

Lil Belgians Kids' Races: FREE races for kids ages 9 and under. Helmets are required, a guardian must be present and sign a release (available at the registration tent). NO racing license required. Space is limited to 50 kids, and for everyone's convenience, please pre-register online at https://www.bikereg.com/falkorburg2024 to guarantee your spot.

 

Registration, Entry Fees, & Licensing:  all registration and payment for this event, including race day registration, will be conducted through BikeReg.  Addtional entries are offered at $20 ($25 on race day) when purchased in the same BikeReg shopping cart.  If the entries are purchased separately during the pre-registration period, contact us for a partial refund; on event day a coupon code will be made available at the day-of registration table to achieve the same discounted price.  Entry fees will increase to $50 for adults and $30 for Junior Men for race day registration (all Junior Women race free this year), to reflect the day-of surcharge.  There will be no in-person sales at the event -- register online, either at home before coming out or on your phone at the event.  You MUST present your racing license (if you have one) or 1-Day receipt in order to be issued a bib, and you should also be prepared to show your confirmation email.  In order to expedite your entry, make sure you have completed the online waiver before approaching the day-of registration table.

This page will re-open for day-of registration by 6 AM;  check-in will open by 7 AM.  Check-in and registration for all races will close 15 minutes prior to the scheduled start of the race.  There will be no exceptions made to this rule -- plan to show up timely for the race you want to enter.

U19 Men & Women may race in any class they qualify for by Cyclocross category, but remain eligible for the Junior entry fee ($0 for U19 Women).  U19 Men ONLY may use coupon code FBX2024_JRS at checkout to receive the Junior pricing; for race day entry, the day-of surcharge will be applied as appropriate.  Any current National Cyclocross Champions shall be granted free entry, but must wear their national jersey in the class in which it was won.

A USA Cycling racing license is required for entry.  Riders who do not provide a USAC Annual racing license # at registration will be assessed an additional $15 for a Beginner 1-Day license.  This license is valid for entry only in fields that are open to Novice Men, Women, or Non-Binary riders.  For all other fields, you must present proof of an active USAC racing license (or a printed Authorization to Ride) showing your Cyclocross category and Racing Age.

Staging & Call Ups: Cat 5 Men's and Cat 4/5 Women’s races are staged based on pre-registration order. The rest of the races are staged according to Super Series standing for the top 8 positions and then based on CrossResults.com rankings for the remainder of pre-registered riders. Race categories and staging information is available https://www.superseriescx.com/about-1. The "Race Day Schedule" table below also provides staging information. 

 

Points: Points are awarded for Series ranking to the following Super Series categories – Men Cat 1,2,3; Women Cat 1,2,3; Men Cat 3, Men Cat 4; Masters 40+ Cat 1,2,3; Masters 50+ Cat 1,2,3,4; Masters 40+/50+ Cat 3, 4, 5; Singlespeed Men, Singlespeed Women; all U19.; Men Cat 5 and Women Cat 4/5 beginner races are not ranked. Professional chip time results by Insight Timing Services. See the Super Series Website for full details about rules and regulations for series points; https://www.superseriescx.com.

Prizes:

. Adults will receive prizes at the promoter’s discretion; typically 5 deep for Falkorburg Cross.

. Juniors will receive medals three places deep.

. Lil’ Belgians races will have medals and snacks for all.

. Single Speed - The legendary traveling Cat Trophies will be back again for the Men’s and Women’s SSCX races this year. Who will claim the coveted trophy this year and win the rights to host the trophy in their home until next year? Plus podium prizes, 5 deep. 

Team tents: Premium tent spots are available for reservation through BikeReg and include one reserved parking spot near the team tent area (so, yeah…you’re really just paying for primo parking). No reservation? No problem. There’s plenty of room for all at Falkorburg Cross. You can use the drop-off loop for your gear and add your tent to the party. Important: For the 2024 Season USAC is requiring teams setting up a tent in a designated team area (pre-paid tent spaces for Falkorburg Cross), to arrive with proof of USAC Safe Sport Certification Safe Sport Training | USA Cycling. This applies to one individual representative for the team who must be present to gain access to the tent row. This requirement does not apply to all of the first-come, first-serve, unreserved team tents that are set up outside of the premium tent spots. 

 

Race Categories & Start Times:

*NOTE: Classes designated “Masters” are open to Men and Women. Minimum Racing Age and categories quoted are for Men; please see the current USAC Rulebook for minimum Racing Age and categories for Women.

 

Contacts:

Race Directors: Rae Meneses, Alex & Ashlea Gray, FalkorburgCX@gmail.com 

Additional info at: facebook.com/falkorburgcx/ 

and https://baltimorebicycleworksracing.com/falkorburg-cx

MatchingEvents.EventName: Apex Technology Youth Tri-X at Lime Rock Park
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
With experience in road, gravel, cyclo-cross and mountain bike events, the organizers of the Lime Rock Park Epic Presented by Specialized recognized a broad potential of this venue. With the construction of two bridges over White Hollow Brook, the speedway venue could be opened to 600 acres and a potential network of trails. Organizers dubbed the trunk line of this potential network “Rattlesnake Ridge". For 2025, we wanted to create a youth mountain bike event….with a bit of a twist. 

 

Recognizing the prestige of racing on the fabled speedway and the spectator potential of some grassy spectator sections, we created a three-surface lap on which to expose youngsters to the wide range of bike racing disciplines. We chose to call it the Tri-X: one part MTB, one part cyclo-cross, and one part road.  

 

This race is expected to require an effort lasting between 20 and 60 minutes. Boys & Girls U18 and U15 will be sent off together, based on number of laps, with 30 seconds between the lap groups. i.e. - All Experts, then all Intermediates 30 seconds later, then all Beginners 30 seconds after that.Within each of those waves, riders will be scored based on gender and their level of experience. Experts with a few seasons racing experience will go five laps; intermediates in their first or second season of racing will compete for three laps. Those riders new to the sport will race just two laps in the beginner category.  

 

This event does not offer USA Cycling points, nor requires a USA Cycling license.  

 

Riders are competing for cool shwag, Vittoria tires,  and some snappy merchandise. Top three in each category will be recognized at the award ceremony.  

NOTE: This event is part of the fourth edition of the Lime Rock Park Epic Presented by Specialized, a gravel fondo that explores the unpaved roads of Litchfield County, and a new Speedway 5K Running Race to Support the Hole in the Wall Gang Camp. After the gravel riders depart the venue for the Epic and Explorer events, organizers will hand the venue over to our non-cycling friends at the Berkshire Running Center, who will host a 5k running event on the fabled Lime Rock Park Speedway. Friends and family may wish to run before the juniors ride. To find out about that, click HERE.   

The venue has free parking, restrooms, and a snack bar. Camping is available Saturday night for just $15 per site. See “Merchandise” for more  information. One car per site, please. 

 

We have limited comp spaces for juniors willing to provide volunteer service to the organizers. Contact Richard@DomestiqueEvents.com for more info.

YES, "day of" registrations are available on a first-come-first-served basis. We can register day-of's up to the field limit for each time slot. Day-of registration for a category closes 30 minutes before the start of that category. There is a $13 additional fee for day-of registrations - no additional fee for juniors or cub juniors. Day-of entries will be staged at the back of their respective fields. One day licenses are $15 and are available for Cat 5 men and Cat 5 women only.

  • Promoter reserves the right to combine races.
  • Additional race is only $15.
  • Day-of registration closes 30min before race start.
  • Any "day-of" registrations will be assigned a position at the back of the field.
  • Combined races will be staged together.  Call up's will be done by bib number/row.
  • Refunds will be given, less BikeReg fees, up until 48 hours of the close of online registration.

Team tents: There are 10 team tent spots available by pre-reg ($20 per spot) and if any spots are left on race day, they will be allotted on a first-come-first-served basis at $20 per spot.

Preriding: NO ONE should be on the course pre-riding during a race. To pre-ride, ONLY enter the course BEYOND the start/finish line when the official confirms that the last rider from the previous field has begun their last lap. DO NOT PASS anyone still racing. Failure to do so will result in disqualification.

Juniors:  Beginner (Cat 4/5) Juniors will race with their corresponding Beginner field (Cat 4/5 Junior men will race with the Cat 5 men, and Cat 4/5 Junior women will race with the Cat 4/5 women).  The Cub Juniors (9-11 & 12-14) will race together (boys and girls) but will have the course to themselves.

High School Participation in Junior Category Race:  Racing age 19 athletes who are enrolled in High School and are part of a High School team or program may participate in the Junior 15-18 category provided they are racing in their High School kit or in a plain unmarked kit if they do not have a school kit.

Directions:
From I-495 north or south, take exit 27 (Bolton/Stow Route 117). Follow Route 117 west for 4 miles to the fairgrounds. Please enter through Gate 2 for parking, which is in the field on the left. Registration will be in the large white tent in the center of the grounds.

MatchingEvents.EventName: Tree House CX | New England Regional CX Championships (RVCX Series)
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
www.bikereg.com/treehousecx

New England Regional CX Championships | Eastern Collegiate Cycling Conference (ECCC) Race  

Pre-Event Festivities Friday, November 1st | Main Event Saturday, November 2nd, 2024 | RAIN OR SHINE EVENT

Tree House Brewing Company | 1 Community Place, South Deerfield MA 

#TreeHouseCX #B2C2Cycling #BikesFightCancer

EVENT OVERVIEW

The team at Tree House, B2C2 Cycling, and Bikes Fight Cancer are coming together again for year three of Tree House CX at the South Deerfield, MA property.  This is a one-of-a-kind event on an amazing property, not to be missed!

The goal of Tree House CX is to deliver a best-in-class New England Cyclocross race that excites and engages the NECX community and Tree House customers.  We strive to:

  • Deliver a premium event that is consistent with Tree House standards
  • Be a race that is welcoming to all, no matter sex, ability or background
  • Deliver a best in class experience for all racers in every category, from new and more junior racers to pros. 
  • Expose spectators to the excitement of CX to create new fans

Tree House CX is part of the River Valley CX Series where there will be cumulative points across multiple races in western Mass. Other races in the series include: Blunt Park, Hydra Cross, Kilowatt Cross, and Blunt Park 2.0.

This race is in partnership with B2C2 Cycling and Bikes Fight Cancer.  These organizations are passionate about making cycling accessible to all, from racing to recreational fundraising. Proceeds from this event will further their efforts. 

INCLUSIVITY POLICY

Tree House CX strives to create an inclusive race environment that is safe and welcoming to all participants, regardless of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, religion, disability, or ethnic origin. Athletes are allowed to compete in the gender category that they identify as. Non-Binary athletes are welcome to compete in the Non-Binary category or any of the Men and Women categories. Trans athletes are welcome to show up as their whole authentic selves. 

We strive to create an atmosphere that makes all feel welcome. From Pros to first-time racers, from staff to spectators, we will not accept or tolerate behavior that is deemed to be bullying or any form of harassment and violators will be asked to leave.  

At any point, if you feel uncomfortable or unsafe or see behavior that seems to be making someone else uncomfortable, please speak to an official or staff member.

FRIDAY EVENTS

On Friday, November 1st we will host a beginner course preview and clinic (more info below), open pre-ride, and a RELAY RACE! The 2-person relay race will switch racers each lap. No age (other than 9+ years old) or skill requirements exist to team up. You're welcome to tag-team with your kid or BFF. The Relay Race begins at 4PM and is a 50 minute race.

FOOD and BEVERAGE

We are happy to be offering the following during the day of the race:

Tree House Beverages - Pouring begins at 11:00 AM
Tree House Pizza - Pizza’s start at 12:00 PM. Slices only on race day
Tree House Coffee Cart - Hot and Cold coffee, all day
Additional Food: TBD

Outside alcohol is not permitted.

FIRST TIME RACERS

We at Tree House CX value the importance of 1st time racers.  We strive to make them feel welcome and will try to ensure they have a positive first experience with Cyclocross. 

There will be an introduction clinic on Friday, November 1st open to all new and beginner riders. You will ride the course and learn how to navigate the twists, turns, and obstacles. You will also learn basic skills to give you an edge on race day. You can sign up on the registration page. 

We recommend bringing a bike that has wider and possibly knobbier tires than a road bike. Your mountain bike, gravel bike, fatbike or even your commuter bike are the perfect tools! Tires that measure more than 35mm are perfect!

We welcome all questions, please message us at B2C2Cycling@gmail.com

REGISTRATION

  • Preregistration closes on Friday, November 1st at 12 PM ET bikereg.com/treehousecx
  • Additional races are $20
  • Limited to 600 Registrations. Field limits for each race are posted in the race schedule.
  • Early bib pick-up on Friday, November 1st between 2 PM - 6 PM. Course preview and clinic will also be available at this time. See above for clinic registration. 
  • Day-Of registration and bib pick-up starts on Saturday, November 2nd at 7:30 AM. The price increases by $10 if there are still spots available
  • Course pre-ride opens at 7:00 AM on Saturday

2024 NEW ENGLAND REGIONAL CYCLOCROSS CHAMPIONSHIPS

Tree House CX is hosting the 2024 New England Regional Cyclocross Championships! Podium awards go to the top three finishers. Championship categories are listed below:

  • Men and Women Elite
  • Men and Women Elite U23
  • Men and Women Junior U13, U15, U17, U19
  • Men Master 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70+
  • Women Master 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60+

NEBRA Guidelines and athlete eligibility can be found here:  

http://nebra.us/nebra-state-and-regional-championship-event-guidelines/

Tree House CX is also part of the Eastern Collegiate Cycling Conference

PARKING 

Event parking will be located in the Northernmost area of the Tree House property. It will be on a grass soccer field North of the paved lot. The race course will be on the South side of the property, it is about a ¼ mile away, so plan accordingly

WARM UP and COURSE PREVIEW

  • Course preview is open between 12 PM - 4 PM on Friday, Nov. 1st. 
  • Course pre-ride opens at 7:00 am on Saturday
  • You may warm-up and ride the course in between races. Absolutely no pre-riding during a race.
  • If you are riding the course between races, you must ride behind, and not pass, the last rider in the race.  

STAGING and STARTING ORDER

Races will be staged with the front row according to the River Valley CX Series and then according to CrossResults Points if registered before Friday, Nov 1st, 2024 at 12:00 PM ET. Athletes who register day-of will be staged in the back as part of the last call-up. 

LAPPED RIDERS

While it's ultimately a decision left to the USA Cycling officials, we did not pull lapped riders in the past and do not expect to pull lapped riders this year.

RESULTS

Results will be posted on CrossResults.com. Combined fields have one start, one set of results, and separate podiums.  

PETS

Well behaved, on leash dogs are welcome on brewery grounds, outside of the building. Please have them say hi to event staff!

  • Secondary race additions or any category changes MUST be done through BikeReg at pre-registration!
  • NO WALK UPS
  • NO Category adds/changes on race day 

Wait! No walk-ups?

  • That's right cupcake, you’ll need to lock it all in before the morning of - oh dear!!
  • But registration is open until 6:00 PM the night before the race.
  • We also have a no-risk registration policy.
  • Seriously, you can do this!

Racer Check-in

  • Opens at 8:30 AM and closes 30 minutes before each race.
  • Secondary race additions or any category changes MUST be done through BikeReg at pre-registration! 

Sanctioning & Licensing

  • This event is USA Cycling sanctioned under event permit 2025-TBD.
  • Racers must have a valid USA Cycling (USAC) license.
  • One-day licenses available on-site for $15 (2024 pricing).

VACX Championship & Promoters

  • If you’re a 2024 VACX Champ, don’t forget to email Dennis at dennis@rvaracing.com for your entry code and use it BEFORE registration closes.

Volunteers Needed!

  • We can’t run this event without you—please sign up through BikeReg to lend a hand.


Whether you’re gunning for the podium or just out to support, we can’t wait to see you for an epic day of cyclocross action.

Online registration closes Thursday, October 16th at 5:00pm. *On-site day of registration is $35. On-site registration opens at 8 a.m. Sunday and closes 30 minutes before each event. We do not require any sort of license to race. This is an unsanctioned race. 

Schedule is tentative and could change based on rider participation. Categories listed together at one specific start time will likely be started separately in short intervals between groups (depending on field size and officials discretion). Riders will be staged by their CrossResults.com rankings at the close of pre-registration. Riders registering on race day will start behind pre-registered riders. 

Each category will have a podium ceremony with prizes approximately 15 minutes after their race.

Parking can be found around the perimeter of the park and off of Quincy Street NE. Contact the Race Director with questions about team tents at the venue. 

Race course is 5 miles from downtown Minneapolis. We encourage bike trains to the venue. 

Race results will be posted to BikeReg within 24 hours of the event to ensure racers' results are reflected for call-ups for future races. 

All proceeds go to the Versus Team Cross Fund so we can host an awesome event for you next year.

MatchingEvents.EventName: Hometown CX p/b Grey Ghost Bicycles
MatchingEvents.EventNotes:
Come join us for the Hometown CX in Glens Falls, NY! The course in Crandall Park will have a little something for every skill set. Sand, fields, high-speed turns, and tech sections, we've got it all. All the proceeds from the race will go to benefit the Grey Ghost NICA race program. This year we will have delicious prizes from our friends at Hick's Orchard!  

After your race, hang out and cheer. We will have breakfast sandwiches, burgers, and other delicious items available for purchase, with all proceeds going to the GGB NICA program, so grab some food and enjoy yourself!  

Sign-in will open at 7:30 am and close 20 minutes prior to each field start. Day of registration available FOR A $10 LATE FEE ($55)!. PLEASE PRE-REGISTER! Staging will be by series rank then crossresults.com ranking for preregistered riders. If you want to race twice, you will receive a discount on your second race, so bring some zip-ties to rig that shifter and race it single speed!

Rules and Race Information

Registration/sign-in will open at 7:30 am and close 20 minutes before each field starts. The first row of staging will be by CBRCX series standing (except for Sunday at Uncle Sam), followed by crossresults.com ranking for preregistered riders and any day of registrants in order of registration.

Oh, and the fine print:

• No sleeveless jerseys, aero bars, or extensions.

• Mountain bikes allowed with bar ends removed.

• Riders must wear a CPSC-certified helmet.

• Racers must have either a USAC or UCI Racing License. One-day licenses are available online through USA Cycling for all fields.

• Cyclocross Racing Age is your age on December 31, *2025*

• Parents must sign a waiver for children under 18 to race.

 

Getting There

GoogleMaps: Crandall Park

From North/South: Take I87 to exit 19. Turn right onto Rt254/Quaker Rd, Turn Right onto Rt9/Glen st. The park will be about a mile down on the right.

From Vermont:  Once in NY take Rt4 to Hudson Falls, Take Rt254 West towards Queensbury/Glens Falls, Turn Left on Rt9/Glens St. The park will be about a mile down on the right.
